commit_message:
Allow admin to list instances in vm_states.DELETED

Command 'nova list --status DELETED' returns nothing at the moment.
Make 'nova list --status DELETED' work for admin.

Change-Id: Ic2caf52ab01898392f7bbbe903347154c0ddcbad

I'm also not a WADL expert, so I can't really judge this patch.

I had a few non-fatal warnings when building this, although I don't know if it's due to this particular patch or not:

[WARNING] 
[WARNING] Some problems were encountered while building the effective model for org.openstack.identity:docs:jar:1.0
[WARNING] 'build.plugins.plugin.version' for org.codehaus.mojo:xml-maven-plugin is missing. @ line 79, column 15
[WARNING]

[WARNING] 
[WARNING] For this reason, future Maven versions might no longer support building such malformed projects.
[WARNING] 
...
Recoverable error on line 558 of file:/Users/lorin/openstack-manuals/doc/src/docbkx/openstack-api-site/target/generated-resources/cloud/normalizeWadl/normalizeWadl1.xsl:

  /Users/lorin/openstack-manuals/doc/src/docbkx/openstack-api-site/src/wadls/image-api/src/xsd/server.xsd (No such file or directory)
(repeated several times)"}, {'account_id': 1795, 'date': '2012-08-14 21:34:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Yes. It addresses the bug that i have filed.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-08-15 00:35:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Thanks for taking a look, everyone, Ravikumar especially. 

My only doubt after looking at it again is the version number. Shouldn't it be v1.1/{tenant_id}/os-volumes
instead of v1?

Since it is an extension for the v1.1 compute API, that's my conclusion, but let me know which is right. I can patch it if needed.

Thanks."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2012-08-15 20:47:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I believe that v 1.1 is correct in this case.  As in novaclient v 1_1.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-08-15 21:44:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-08-15 21:44:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

[{'created': '2012-08-10 16:48:05.000000000', 'message': 'Bug #1030039 - added os-volumes, os-snapshots, os-volume-types

Change-Id: I5f09526b329037a5862157751694d90abf9af13e
'}, {'created': '2012-08-15 21:44:12.000000000', 'message': 'Bug #1030039 - added os-volumes, os-snapshots, os-volume-types

Patchset:
moved the os-volume wadl to be a compute extension
renamed the volume API wadl to just volume-api.wadl
so that the os-volume extension wadl can be os-volume.wadl
fixes some problems with xml:lang referring to E instead of EN
Updates the pom to find the right new file name

Change-Id: I5f09526b329037a5862157751694d90abf9af13e
'}]
commit_message:
Bug #1030039 - added os-volumes, os-snapshots, os-volume-types

Patchset:
moved the os-volume wadl to be a compute extension
renamed the volume API wadl to just volume-api.wadl
so that the os-volume extension wadl can be os-volume.wadl
fixes some problems with xml:lang referring to E instead of EN
Updates the pom to find the right new file name

Change-Id: I5f09526b329037a5862157751694d90abf9af13e

commit_message:
heat cli : Workaround inconsistent boto return type

Work around the inconsistent boto return type for DescribeStackResource
action, upstream patch pending but not yet merged, so this provides
a simple workaround

Fixes #175

Change-Id: I026ec7b1845fb591a47a5fb12cfcb25705b33909
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
heat cli : Rework to separate cli tool from client-API wrappers

Rework to remove duplication between heat and heat-boto, and to
provide better separation between the CLI tool logic and the
underlying client API (should allow easier porting to new ReST API)

Ref #175 (partially fixes)
Fixes #192

Change-Id: Ib1f821667c40c78770a345204af923163daeffae
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

@Akihiro: I want to leave this code in for now for two reasons:

1. I'm going for minimally invasive changes at this point. The code that's already removed is safe, removing farther would require changing some underlying assumptions about the order of input in workflow data.

2. I intend to revisit this code later in such a way that a regular user with multiple projects may be able to do more intelligent things with their resources. This is a Grizzly timeframe item at least."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-15 19:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

[{'created': '2012-08-15 01:26:29.000000000', 'message': 'Removes the admin launch instance function.

It was added as a proof-of-concept for workflows, primarily,
and it has grave implications for security, accounting, and
other concerns. Given that no one even asked for the feature
to begin with, it seems wiser to take it back out.

Fixes bug 1036233.

Change-Id: I59ba56d2eae4b590ecd4671c1ae9e784a9861e39
'}]
commit_message:
Removes the admin launch instance function.

It was added as a proof-of-concept for workflows, primarily,
and it has grave implications for security, accounting, and
other concerns. Given that no one even asked for the feature
to begin with, it seems wiser to take it back out.

Fixes bug 1036233.

Change-Id: I59ba56d2eae4b590ecd4671c1ae9e784a9861e39

commit_message:
Catch an exception of API call when retrieving quota usage.

Fixes bug 1037438

Before this commit, api.nova.tenant_quota_usages() is called multiple
times when rendering a template. This commit fixes it and now the API
call is called only once.

Change-Id: Ia9eb1fb2b956966ad26501e7b6af65e927067f20

"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-07 19:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

a) small nit inline

b) still have quite a few failing tests:

https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-python26/3965/testReport/?

c) there are some concerns with rpc versioning. Requesting a review from russelb to explain how to do the rpc versioning porperly.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-07 19:48:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(13 inline comments)

Take a look at the docs at the top of nova/openstack/common/rpc/dispatcher.py about rpc api versioning.  These changes break the rpc apis in quite a few places.  Backwards compatibility must be preserved and versions need to be updated.  This also means that instance_id can not completely go away immediately."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-07 19:49:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Once you've had a chance to look over some of the versioning code and how it's used in some other places, I'd be happy to help you figure out the specific changes needed."}, {'account_id': 1313, 'date': '2012-08-08 02:32:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Russell:
so it would be better for me to do this after the rpc version
has been fully accomplished? in the meantime, I will fix the unittest and keep a eye on the rpc version update.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-08 16:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yaguang: No the rpc stuff is finished, but rather than change the parameter passing from instance_id -> instance_uuid and then doing another change to just pass in the entire instance object, the methods that were using instance_id were changed to pass the whole instance object.

The idea with rpc versioning is to be backwards compatibile, however. So we need to keep instance_id in place in case the manager gets an old message that contains instance_id. Russel is suggesting that you roll back your changes to the rpc layer, since new code will be passing the whole instance object. The old code that loads the instance from instance_id is just for compatibility so it is fine to leave it.'}, {'account_id': 1313, 'date': '2012-08-08 18:08:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1313, 'date': '2012-08-08 18:09:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Use instance uuid instead of instance id in args and methods.

This patch removes the db access to column 'id' of instances
table.Make all methods to force use instance uuid as args
instead of instance id.so instance id is only used for ec2
id compatibilty.
Implement bp:ec2-id-compatibilty

Change-Id: Id114d1bbd099fabb156878a1cbf87f61d72076fb

[{'created': '2012-07-23 19:16:55.000000000', 'message': 'Add a test that creates a flavor with the same name as a previously deleted flavor.

This test (test_create_flavor_name_duplicated) is for bug 1026210.  It simply creates a flavor, deletes it, and attempts to create another flavor with the same name as the first.

This change is written by, and being submitted on behalf of, Diego Mendonca <diego.mattiello-mendonca@hp.com>.

Change-Id: Ibe6d5668600c65caf0ce8e96f40125dcf11f1f82
'}]
commit_message:
Add a test that creates a flavor with the same name as a previously deleted flavor.

This test (test_create_flavor_name_duplicated) is for bug 1026210.  It simply creates a flavor, deletes it, and attempts to create another flavor with the same name as the first.

This change is written by, and being submitted on behalf of, Diego Mendonca <diego.mattiello-mendonca@hp.com>.

Change-Id: Ibe6d5668600c65caf0ce8e96f40125dcf11f1f82

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-09 04:14:10.000000000', 'message': 'Implements bp migrate-nova-volumes-to-cinder

  Part of the needed steps to transition from nova to cinder

  Implements and import section in cinder-manage to transfer
  applicable tables from local or remote Nova database into a
  fresh Cinder database.

  Also implements optional method to copy persistent targets.

  Remaining work for bp is in the form of a devstack script
  to install/configure cinder services and use these features
  to populate DB.

Change-Id: I2e655e26c55f1986f3b1554726cead9e73ee9bd6
'}, {'created': '2012-08-14 22:33:01.000000000', 'message': 'Implements bp migrate-nova-volumes-to-cinder

  Helper cmds to transition from nova to cinder

  Implements an import section in cinder-manage to transfer
  applicable tables from local or remote Nova database into a
  fresh Cinder database.

  Also implements optional method to copy persistent target files.

Change-Id: I2e655e26c55f1986f3b1554726cead9e73ee9bd6
'}]
commit_message:
Implements bp migrate-nova-volumes-to-cinder

  Helper cmds to transition from nova to cinder

  Implements an import section in cinder-manage to transfer
  applicable tables from local or remote Nova database into a
  fresh Cinder database.

  Also implements optional method to copy persistent target files.

Change-Id: I2e655e26c55f1986f3b1554726cead9e73ee9bd6

commit_message:
Update SolidFire volume driver

Implements blueprint update-solidfire-driver

* Updates driver to reflect changes in the release version of SF API
* Modify SF naming scheme
* Implement snapshot functionality
* Implement setting qos on create via metadata
* Update/Add tests

Change-Id: I08f7aac31e9d95f971d297a19c285dfa7151b931

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-14 15:18:06.000000000', 'message': "add ability to clone images

Given the backend location from Glance, drivers can determine whether
they can clone or otherwise efficiently create a volume from the image
without downloading all the data from Glance.

The backend location is only exposed by the Glance v2 API,
so add a version parameter to each Glance call within the
ImageService wrapper.

For now implement cloning for the RBD driver. There's already
a Glance backend that stores images as RBD snapshots, so they're
ready to be cloned into volumes. Fall back to copying all the data
if cloning is not possible.

Change-Id: I71a8172bd22a5bbf64d4c68631630125fcc7fd34
Implements: blueprint efficient-volumes-from-images
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>

commit_message:
add ability to clone images

Given the backend location from Glance, drivers can determine
whether they can clone or otherwise efficiently create a volume
from the image without downloading all the data from Glance.

For now implement cloning for the RBD driver. There's already a
Glance backend that stores images as RBD snapshots, so they're
ready to be cloned into volumes. Fall back to copying all the
data if cloning is not possible.

Change-Id: I71a8172bd22a5bbf64d4c68631630125fcc7fd34
Implements: blueprint efficient-volumes-from-images
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>

messages:

'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-08-15 17:27:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I can't reproduce the reported bug.

The test_create_missing_server test case works fine for me.

I think we need a better explanation of why it fails for you and works for me (and presumably jenkins) before approving this fix."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-08-15 17:31:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I can verify that it fails...and this patch is actually exactly what I did to fix it.  I ran into this last night on our jenkins.  Do you use tox or run_tests.sh ?  It doesn't fail for me locally either... but I still use run_tests.sh... and we're using tox in jenkins.  That's the only difference I can think of..

The problem makes sense, though.. and really it should be failing every time.   test_scheduler_hints is forcing a test case where there's no 'server'.  And the disk_config extension is barfing on it.  I wonder if the extension loading order is different... that would explain it."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-08-15 17:38:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The gate between gerritt and github also uses tox.

I'm not denying that someone is seeing a problem with tests since the bug report clearly shows it failing for Dan, but the fix doesn't make any sense.

How is it still returning a 400 error if the code doesn't do anything when the 'server' key is missing?

I'm also unsure why the rebuild and resize actions are now looking for the 'server' key now instead of 'rebuild' and 'resize' keys before (isn't this an API change?). I'm also unsure why those actions are in the disk_config extension in the first place. They are already implemented in nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py.

So many questions! :)

I suspect there's a deeper problem and this patch just papers over it. The correct fix is somewhere else..."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-08-15 17:41:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

comstud: I use run_tests.sh locally (where I'm seeing the failure). Sounds like using tox vs. run_tests.sh isn't the issue.

You might be onto something with the extension load order however. Let me see what I can figure out. If you find anything else on your end let me know...

---

Johannes: I'll try to write a test that causes this to fail (even though it alread does for me)... or at least trick you into thinking I've done so ;)"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-08-15 17:43:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

No time for me to spend on this right now... but I'd love to know the answer at some point.  Right now, I don't care... I fixed it for us. :)   I'd +2 this if it weren't for johannes's thoughts."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-08-15 17:54:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Johannes,

Not sure I agree with your "papers over" assertion. I totally agree that there is something deeper here... I'll dig into that when I can. In the meantime it is really annoying that tests fail on Nova master for me.

What this patch does is in fact totally reasonable though. Checking to make sure a dict contains an object before trying to accessing (thus causing a KeyError) is arguably good coding practice.

In any case I really hate this being in trunk today since we are going to cut a milestone that can't run unit tests. Just my take.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-08-15 17:58:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

-1 because of inline comment... but:

Johannes: extension ordering would explain it completely.  The 400 check in test_scheduler_hints doesn't get hit.. because disk_config is doing something first.  In the cases that pass, I'm guessing disk_config is after scheduler_hints... so scheduler_hints raises all of the way back out before disk_config gets a chance to KeyError."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-08-15 18:29:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

A 400 error is what is expected (both by the test and by convention with the other code).

Doing nothing if the 'server' key is missing doesn't ensure that a 400 gets raised.

So I stand by my assertion that this patch just papers over the problem.

It looks like Chris is correct and that this is an ordering problem with other extensions.

The correct fix appears to be to mimic the scheduler_hints extensions and raise an exception if 'server' is missing.

Also, I opened up a bug 1037227 to test extensions individually in the future to ensure bugs like this don't get hidden.

Ultimately, I dislike rushing through bugs like this and not taking the time to understand the problem. We have examples of bug fixes like this (for instance bug 838581) which ended up biting us in the ass again because we didn't take the time to understand the problem when we first saw it."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-15 18:40:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I actually think the fix is correct for create. Create doesn't always have a 'server' in the body of the response. If, for example you use 'return_reservation_id' = True in the request. It should only decorate the response if server is there.

I ran into this when I was updating the security_groups extension and tests. I think checking for 'server' in the body in the other methods is unnecessary but I don't think it will hurt anything."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-08-15 18:41:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Johannes: I agree with your overall message re: understanding problems, etc.  And testing extensions definitely should not interfere with each other in unit tests.  I also agree that disk_config should also raise the same way scheduler_hints does...   but I don't feel like it *has to*.  One could decide that disk_config doesn't care if 'server' exists or not.... but that scheduler_hints does care.  This is a bad example use-case, because 'server' should always exist for a create, but you can probably see what I mean.  In that case, extension writers will need to take care when they write code to ignore what they want to ignore.

That said, sometimes there's no time to completely understand the problem *now*.  But yes, that means no one will follow up later... and there's great potential to be bitten later.  Last night, fixing this with a reasonable guess and getting some sleep was my highest priority.  For trunk, more investigation is probably wise."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-15 18:42:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

actually, cancel that, this is before the yield, so server should always be there. Is there a test that is passing bad data to check for an exception?'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-08-15 18:48:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

vish: yeah: scheduler_hints tests for a 400 raised if malformed body is sent (ie, body without 'server')

if disk_config is before scheduler_hints, it raises KeyError."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-15 18:56:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I'm good with this fix going in."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-08-15 19:44:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

(2 inline comments)

I'm putting up a -2 since there was a +2 and the changes to the rebuild and resize actions appear to be incorrect after reading the rest of the code and the API docs.

Also, I'm not a fan of silently ignoring missing attributes that are normally required. There was a bug recently that would have been caught if it was correctly treated as required (see bug 1034948). But I won't hold up this patch for that."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-08-15 21:11:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-08-15 21:15:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

This looks much better. Thanks for the work on this'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-08-15 21:18:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

See the new commit comment for changes.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-15 21:40:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

[{'created': '2012-08-15 17:09:47.000000000', 'message': "Update disk config to check for 'server' in req.

Updates the disk config extension to check for 'server' in the
request body before trying to use it. This avoids a potential
KeyError exception and fixes the test_create_missing_server
test in the scheduler_hints extension.

Fixes LP Bug #1037201.

Change-Id: I912fc1234b2e7a76ecc54140f4a31c2e32fdfa98
"}, {'created': '2012-08-15 21:11:45.000000000', 'message': "Update disk config to check for 'server' in req.

Updates the disk config extension to check for 'server' in the
request body before trying to use it. This avoids a potential
KeyError exception. Given that we already validate the 'server'
dict in servers.py and raise a proper exception there this seems
reasonable to me... no reason to duplicate all of the validation
logic.

The reason this change was able to make it into Nova to begin
with is that the Extensions loader orders things differently
depending on the OS/python version being used. I tested this
by running SchedulerHintsTestCase.test_create_missing_server
on both Fedora 16 (passes) and Fedora 17 (fails). The problem
only manifests itself when the disk config extension gets called
before the scheduler_hints extension. To fix this issue
I've updated the scheduler_hints extensions in this patchset
to simply pass when 'server' isn't defined which like above seems
reasonable because we already validate this in servers.py.

As part of this fix I'm also moving test_create_missing_server out
of the Scheduler Hints tests and into a new ServersAllExtensionsTestCase
class in test_servers.py which explicitly tests for things with *all*
extensions enabled. As part of the move I also updated the test to
look for HTTP 422 Unprocessable Entity which is what we throw when
'server' doesn't exist in a POST to servers (the correct exception).

Fixes LP Bug #1037201.

Change-Id: I912fc1234b2e7a76ecc54140f4a31c2e32fdfa98
"}]
commit_message:
Update disk config to check for 'server' in req.

Updates the disk config extension to check for 'server' in the
request body before trying to use it. This avoids a potential
KeyError exception. Given that we already validate the 'server'
dict in servers.py and raise a proper exception there this seems
reasonable to me... no reason to duplicate all of the validation
logic.

The reason this change was able to make it into Nova to begin
with is that the Extensions loader orders things differently
depending on the OS/python version being used. I tested this
by running SchedulerHintsTestCase.test_create_missing_server
on both Fedora 16 (passes) and Fedora 17 (fails). The problem
only manifests itself when the disk config extension gets called
before the scheduler_hints extension. To fix this issue
I've updated the scheduler_hints extensions in this patchset
to simply pass when 'server' isn't defined which like above seems
reasonable because we already validate this in servers.py.

As part of this fix I'm also moving test_create_missing_server out
of the Scheduler Hints tests and into a new ServersAllExtensionsTestCase
class in test_servers.py which explicitly tests for things with *all*
extensions enabled. As part of the move I also updated the test to
look for HTTP 422 Unprocessable Entity which is what we throw when
'server' doesn't exist in a POST to servers (the correct exception).

Fixes LP Bug #1037201.

Change-Id: I912fc1234b2e7a76ecc54140f4a31c2e32fdfa98

So the reason the test_deprecated tests are failing is:

You need to sync cinder/utils.py with the latest nova/utils.py. In Nova we removed the 'deprecation stuff' from utils.py (it was a bit overkill for what we needed). Whats happening is both utils.py and common/deprecated.py are registering a show_warnings handler.

commit_message:
Add proper support for deprecation messages

Add support for warning once about deprecated options. Use that in
the rootwrap options deprecation message, and move it to run_as_root
so that the deprecated message is emitted once and only if used.

Change-Id: I29e39c662b4456256f4c9397f305bfa857972c46

It had gotten lost in a previous commit.

The new config option really bugs me. If we know that only xen respects this parameter then why not just do the right thing - e.g. making get_unused_device() a virt driver method which would be a no-op under Xen

Put it another way, to configure nova with libvirt correctly, users need to know to set ignore_attach_device=True. That seems kinda crazy.

Did you consider the option of just rejecting an attach request if the user specifies a target device and we can't support it?"}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-13 15:23:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-14 10:22:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Some discussion on the list here - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2012-August/000566.html

To be explicit about this, we're changing an existing API here

Clients may have been passing conflicting or invalid device names before and the API request would succeed, even if the device didn't show up where requested in the guest. Since the device name was a required parameter before, there's a reasonable chance this will break some clients. However, since these clients would only have worked with libvirt and not xenserver, they're already broken.

+1 on the API change from me.


Random observations:

Tempest won't be affected - it's attach test starts a new instance and attaches a volume as vdb

Horizon won't be affected because it doesn't try and guess a device name

Interestingly, Horizon has a way of disabling the device field from the attach form - you can set OPENSTACK_HYPERVISOR_FEATURES.can_set_mount_point to False"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-14 10:29:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Hmm, we have a race condition - between the time that validate_device() returns and attach_volume() asynchronously finishes, there is no block device mapping for the device ... so another client can come along and be allocated the same device

This is probably trivial to reproduce - if you issue two attachment requests without a device name, I'm guessing they both get the same device name"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-14 16:55:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-14 17:08:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Doesn't seem to work

Nice fix for the race condition, but we risk leaking block device names here if the attach fails

I guess I'm ok with fixing this later, but it's nasty - attach can fail before or after the attach_device cast so we need to handle deleting the mapping in both cases

Also, if you do re-spin this again ... reserve_block_device_name() would make more sense than validate_device()"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-14 22:08:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-14 22:12:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-06 19:21:16.000000000', 'message': 'Allow nova to guess device if not passed to attach

partial fix for bug 1004328

Only the xen hypervisor actually respects the device name that
is passed in attach_volume. For other hypervisors it makes much
more sense to automatically generate a unique name.

This patch generates a non-conflicting device name if one is not
passed to attach_volume. A corresponding change to novaclient
and horizon will greatly improve the user experience of attaching
a volume.

The next step is to allow the user to specify an identifier that
can be used for the uuid so they can match the device in the guest
more easily.

Change-Id: I0b9454fc50a5c93b4aea38545dcee98f68d7e511
'}, {'created': '2012-08-06 22:35:27.000000000', 'message': 'Allow nova to guess device if not passed to attach

partial fix for bug 1004328

Only the xen hypervisor actually respects the device name that
is passed in attach_volume. For other hypervisors it makes much
more sense to automatically generate a unique name.

This patch generates a non-conflicting device name if one is not
passed to attach_volume. A corresponding change to novaclient
and horizon will greatly improve the user experience of attaching
a volume.

It moves some common code out of metadata/base so that it can
be used to get a list of block devices. The code was functionally
tested as well and block device name generation works properly.

The next step is to allow the user to specify an identifier that
can be used for the uuid so they can match the device in the guest
more easily.

Change-Id: I0b9454fc50a5c93b4aea38545dcee98f68d7e511
'}, {'created': '2012-08-08 20:51:09.000000000', 'message': 'Allow nova to guess device if not passed to attach

partial fix for bug 1004328

Only the xen hypervisor actually respects the device name that
is passed in attach_volume. For other hypervisors it makes much
more sense to automatically generate a unique name.

This patch generates a non-conflicting device name if one is not
passed to attach_volume. A corresponding change to novaclient
and horizon will greatly improve the user experience of attaching
a volume.

It moves some common code out of metadata/base so that it can
be used to get a list of block devices. The code was functionally
tested as well and block device name generation works properly.

This adds a new method to the rpcapi to get an unused volume. It
also adds server_id to the volumes extension, since it was omitted
by mistake.

The next step is to allow the user to specify an identifier that
can be used for the uuid so they can match the device in the guest
more easily.

Change-Id: I0b9454fc50a5c93b4aea38545dcee98f68d7e511
'}, {'created': '2012-08-08 21:10:47.000000000', 'message': 'Allow nova to guess device if not passed to attach

partial fix for bug 1004328

Only the xen hypervisor actually respects the device name that
is passed in attach_volume. For other hypervisors it makes much
more sense to automatically generate a unique name.

commit_message:
Allow nova to guess device if not passed to attach

partial fix for bug 1004328

Only the xen hypervisor actually respects the device name that
is passed in attach_volume. For other hypervisors it makes much
more sense to automatically generate a unique name.

This patch generates a non-conflicting device name if one is not
passed to attach_volume. It also validates the passed in volume
name to make sure another device isn't already attached there.

A corresponding change to novaclient and horizon will greatly
improve the user experience of attaching a volume.

It moves some common code out of metadata/base so that it can
be used to get a list of block devices. The code was functionally
tested as well and block device name generation works properly.

This adds a new method to the rpcapi to validate a device name. It
also adds server_id to the volumes extension, since it was omitted
by mistake.

The next step is to modify the libvirt driver to match the serial
number of the device to the volume uuid so that the volume can
always be found at /dev/disk/by-id/virtio-<uuid>.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I0b9454fc50a5c93b4aea38545dcee98f68d7e511

'}, {'created': '2012-08-02 15:56:32.000000000', 'message': 'Make ComputeFilter verify compute-related instance properties

This change adds checks in the ComputeFilter to verify compute hosts can
support the (architecture, hypervisor_type, vm_mode) triple specified
in the instance properties, improving support for heterogeneous clouds.

Images can be marked with the architecture, hypervisor, and virtual
machine mode they require, e.g.

glance image-update --property architecture=x86_64 \
  --property hypervisor_type=kvm <image-uuid>
glance image-update --property architecture=i686 \
  --property hypervisor_type=xen --property vm_mode=xen <image-uuid>
glance image-update --property architecture=x86_64 \
  --property hypervisor_type=xen --property vm_mode=hvm <image-uuid>

These properties are included in the request_spec part of the run_instance
RPC message and made available to the ComputeFilter.  The ComputeFilter
will only pass compute nodes that satisfy the specified properties.
If no properties are specified, the ComputeFilter behavior is unchanged.

Adding these checks to the compute filter seems consistent with its
definition [1]:

"ComputeFilter - checks that the capabilities provided by the compute
service satisfy the extra specifications, associated with the instance
type."

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/doc/source/devref/filter_scheduler.rst

DocImpact

Change-Id: I993f2e222ec036f1045f3cc5cc1851e730962729

commit_message:
Make ComputeFilter verify compute-related instance properties

This change adds checks in the ComputeFilter to verify compute hosts can
support the (architecture, hypervisor_type, vm_mode) triple specified
in the instance properties, improving support for heterogeneous clouds.

Images can be marked with the architecture, hypervisor, and virtual
machine mode they require, e.g.

glance image-update --property architecture=x86_64 \
  --property hypervisor_type=kvm <image-uuid>
glance image-update --property architecture=i686 \
  --property hypervisor_type=xen --property vm_mode=xen <image-uuid>
glance image-update --property architecture=x86_64 \
  --property hypervisor_type=xen --property vm_mode=hvm <image-uuid>

These properties are included in the request_spec part of the run_instance
RPC message and made available to the ComputeFilter.  The ComputeFilter
will only pass compute nodes that satisfy the specified properties.
If no properties are specified, the ComputeFilter behavior is unchanged.

Adding these checks to the compute filter seems consistent with its
definition [1]:

"ComputeFilter - checks that the capabilities provided by the compute
service satisfy the extra specifications, associated with the instance
type."

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/doc/source/devref/filter_scheduler.rst

DocImpact

Change-Id: I993f2e222ec036f1045f3cc5cc1851e730962729

commit_message:
Collect instance capabilities from compute nodes

This change collects a list of supported instances from compute nodes.
Each supported instance is a tuple, containing the triple
(architecture, hypervisor_type, vm_mode).  This list of tuples describes
all of the instances supported by the compute node, which can then be
used by the ComputeFilter to ensure proper placement of an instance in
a heterogeneous compute node cloud.

Change-Id: I059ff55c165b372c83e63390b40a2c165df1f717

commit_message:
Changes default behavior of ec2

Changes the default behaviour of create instance min/max count logic
in ec2 to match the default behavior of OS API

Fixes bug 989799

Updates Image attribute updated_at

When the image properties are updated, the image attribute updated_at
should be updated as well.

Fixes bug 1036507

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-python27/383/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-08-15 21:21:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Mark: We're already using a global here. Changing the global on every cast/call/fanout would be likely to break stuff.

The only alternative is to actually pass the conf variable everywhere. 

The reason the conf variable was introduced was simply to ease the migration to openstack-common, before Nova was using openstack.common.cfg."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-08-15 21:21:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I still think that as long as the driver is going to force the global, it shouldn't be calling a method that is essentially a noop. These lines would be removed regardless.

Moving away from the global is going to be a much more complicated patch."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-08-15 21:21:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Mark, if that was the case, I'd need to patch register_opts(). At the moment, the code is setting it to cfg.CONF on initialization. Then, the individual methods call register_opts(), but it is essentially a no-op because:

    if not CONF:                                                                 
        conf.register_opts(zmq_opts)                                             
        CONF = conf"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-15 21:21:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I'm not terribly convinced, but I haven't dug very deeply

One possibility is that the conf argument is there to support the use of the rpc code with a non-global ConfigOpts instance. This is an excellent thing for an openstack-common API to support - i.e. default to cfg.CONF, but allow callers to use a different object. If this is the case, then the register_opts() is needed

Another possibility is that the conf argument from these methods should just be removed and the code should only work with cfg.CONF"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-15 21:21:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Meh, it's a bit half-assed either way

I'd like to see the work towards supporting non-global ConfigOpts moving forwards rather than backwards but, compared to the rest of the work needed, this isn't a big deal to re-instate."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-15 21:21:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-15 21:21:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Nova was using openstack.common.cfg long before any of this.  The reason the conf arg was added was from before the global conf object existed there.  Once it was added, the rpc code got simplified to use it, but the work that was done to pass conf around was left.  It would be nice to see the work continued to be able to cleanly support both global config, and not using it.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-15 21:21:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-merge/519/consoleFull : SUCCESS

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-python26/387/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-python27/387/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-15 21:21:50.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Remove register_opts from client methods

During the nova->common migration,
it was required to call register_opts on every
client RPC api call. This is no longer required
with cfg.CONF.

Change-Id: Ia46c5d54e68c4d86a87570b2caff0da9755ca931

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-13 19:22:50.000000000', 'message': 'Change IPtablesManager to preserve packet:byte counts.

Modified IPtablesManager.apply() method to save/restore chain and
rule packet:byte counts by using the '-c' flag with iptables-save
and iptables-restore calls.  Currently they are zeroed every time
we change something in the table.  This will allow users to better
analyze usage for instances over an extended period of time, for
example, for billing purposes.

Change all applicable iptables, libvirt and Xen tests to account
for the changes made to support the packet:byte counts.

This work uncovered two bugs in the existing implementation
found during my testing, specifically:

1. Fix IptablesManager to clean-up non-wrapped chains correctly,
   instead of leaving them in the kernel's table.  We now keep a
   list of chains and rules we need to remove, and double-check
   in apply() that they are filtered-out.

2. Fix IptablesManager to honor "top=True" iptables rules by only
   adding non-top rules after we've gone through all the top rules
   first.

Implements first work item of blueprint libvirt-network-usage.

Change-Id: Ia5a11aabbfb45b6c16c8d94757eeaa2041785b60

commit_message:
Change IPtablesManager to preserve packet:byte counts.

Modified IPtablesManager.apply() method to save/restore chain and
rule packet:byte counts by using the '-c' flag with iptables-save
and iptables-restore calls.  Currently they are zeroed every time
we change something in the table.  This will allow users to better
analyze usage for instances over an extended period of time, for
example, for billing purposes.

Change all applicable iptables, libvirt and Xen tests to account
for the changes made to support the packet:byte counts.

This work uncovered two bugs in the existing implementation
found during my testing, specifically:

1. Fix IptablesManager to clean-up non-wrapped chains correctly,
   instead of leaving them in the kernel's table.  We now keep a
   list of chains and rules we need to remove, and double-check
   in apply() that they are filtered-out.

2. Fix IptablesManager to honor "top=True" iptables rules by only
   adding non-top rules after we've gone through all the top rules
   first.

Implements first work item of blueprint libvirt-network-usage.

Fixes bug 1037127 and bug 1037137.

Change-Id: Ia5a11aabbfb45b6c16c8d94757eeaa2041785b60

commit_message:
Add policy enforcment for v2 api.

This patch adds policy checks in the images controller for all actions that need
to be enforced. It also fixed an issue with unit tests where the v1 unitests
were testing less than they should be. This was due to the default policy being
overridden in the test and causing a forbidden to be raised whenever policys
were changed, regardless of the policy rule added.

Fixes bug 1036846

Change-Id: Ib351d8c1e13164d02b02685c808b30045f7850ea

commit_message:
Fix nova volume install for devstack

This changes does mkdir -p /etc/tgt/conf.d to avoid the following
error, when nova volume is enabled (perhaps limited to xenapi)
tee: /etc/tgt/conf.d/nova.conf: No such file or directory

Change-Id: Ia5804c7ff50fbf1bc41e14ad13923c9261b000e0

'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-07-26 18:00:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The hypervisor_type is already available in the ComputeNode table/model. Is there a reason to duplicate that information in the Instance table/model?"}, {'account_id': 2697, 'date': '2012-07-26 18:33:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I've added it to the instance model to allow specifying a hypervisor type for an instance/image.  E.g. it would allow specifying the compute characteristics of an image

glance image-update --property architecture=x86_64 --property hypervisor_type=kvm img1
glance image-update --property architecture=x86_64 --property hypervisor_type=xen --property vm_mode=hvm

which can then be used by the ComputeFilter to select appropriate nodes."}, {'account_id': 2697, 'date': '2012-07-27 16:28:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2697, 'date': '2012-07-27 16:32:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Rebased the series.

Jay, did I answer your question?  IIUC, I need hypervisor_type in the instance so it is available in the instance properties made available to the ComputeFilter.  I'm just learning this code so might be overlooking something.  Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-27 16:48:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-07-27 20:21:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Jim, what's I'm saying is that I don't see the need to add another column to the Instances table for hypervisor_type, because the information is only used in the scheduler -- if a scheduling request includes a filter on hypervisor_type, that information can be gleaned from the image properties (as you have properly done in the change to nova/compute/api.py). Nova does not need to store this information (AFAICT) in the instances table as it's not information that is shown in any API call or used in any calculations anywhere. So, I'm saying just remove the change to the model and remove the migration script. :)"}, {'account_id': 2697, 'date': '2012-07-28 06:38:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Include hypervisor_type in instance base options

The hypervisor_type specified in the image is needed by a subsequent
patch to the ComputeFilter which filters compute hosts against the
triple (architecture, hypervisor_type, vm_mode).

Change-Id: Ia079de2493c3e2823669c08a845af18d3a53afac

commit_message:
add get_location method for images

This is useful for determining whether the backend storage for the
image in Glance is the same as the storage used in a volume driver.

The direct_url is only available in the v2 images API, so add a
version parameter to each request. As more parts of the v2 API are
used, this parameter will become more useful.

Change-Id: I5ca06b6d80ffe4118f8dd381ed11283573bce71f
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>

[{'created': '2012-08-11 03:10:55.000000000', 'message': "Remove utils.deprecated functions.

We don't seem to use utils.deprecated at all... so lets
remove it and save ourselves 200 lines of code.

Also moves a couple misc. test cases in utils.py out of the
DeprecationTest suite and into the GenericUtilsTestCase

commit_message:
Remove utils.deprecated functions.

We don't seem to use utils.deprecated at all... so lets
remove it and save ourselves 200 lines of code.

Also moves a couple misc. test cases in utils.py out of the
DeprecationTest suite and into the GenericUtilsTestCase
suite.

Change-Id: I96e93d8fa056110057c8855f2ce52c9f55cd4a9b

commit_message:
Ensure v1 'limit' query parameter works correctly.

The tests were present but were not asserting list results.

page_size was overriding the absolute limit so limits were
not working if they were less than the page_size.

Fixes bug 1037233

Change-Id: If102824212e3846bc65d3f7928cf7aa2e48aaa63

Love it!'}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2012-08-15 16:14:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

One comment on the second bug - 
Okay, for Essex the terminate action returns an error if the instance is in suspended mode. But what happens, if the instances is in suspended mode in Folsom, and for some reason it cannot be resumed? You will not be able to deleted it too, although Nova allows it.. For me it seems like hiding new functionality just to hide a potential error message?

I'd go with a more detailed error message instead, showing some hint. This was discussed with another bug, that the action button error handling should be improved, and custom messages to be allowed to be returned to users. Then this fix will be easy to handle."}, {'account_id': 1205, 'date': '2012-08-15 17:33:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I'm +2ing but wont approve until gabriel get's the chance to respond to review comments."}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-08-15 18:48:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

when that method was refactored away.

commit_message:
Adds support for autogenerated device on attach

In order to keep backwards compatibility, use 'auto' as a positional
parameter to allow nova to automatically generate the device name
for the attached volume.

Also, prints the result of the attach so that the user can see which
device was selected.

Change-Id: I25ad8eac48b9a085268627435b68ad20d1fb3c4c

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-08 19:01:40.000000000', 'message': "Allow resources to use any field as 'name'

The 'name' field for some resources is called something different,
for example 'display_name' for volumes. There was a hack in our
find method to search for display_name as well.

This change adds a new class variable to a Resource to tell it
which attribute to use for searching by name. Volumes and snapshots
were switched to use 'display_name' and hypervisors were switched
to use 'hypervisor_hostname'.

Tests fixed and added.

Fixes bug 1034536

Change-Id: I1b4fb969d42c59d1ab8e3e275a563bbe158e9264
"}]
commit_message:
Allow resources to use any field as 'name'

The 'name' field for some resources is called something different,
for example 'display_name' for volumes. There was a hack in our
find method to search for display_name as well.

This change adds a new class variable to a Resource to tell it
which attribute to use for searching by name. Volumes and snapshots
were switched to use 'display_name' and hypervisors were switched
to use 'hypervisor_hostname'.

Tests fixed and added.

Fixes bug 1034536

Change-Id: I1b4fb969d42c59d1ab8e3e275a563bbe158e9264

commit_message:
Allow different auth providers via plugin system.

- Remove the NOVA_RAX_AUTH hack and provide (temporary) compatibility
  with the new system.
- Example plugin for RAX and HP provided here :
    RAX - https://github.com/emonty/rackspace-auth-openstack
    HP - https://github.com/emonty/hpcloud-auth-openstack
- Plugin are allowed to specify their own auth_url directly.
- Thanks to mtaylor for helping on this.

Change-Id: Ie96835be617c6a20d9c3fc3bd1536083aecfdc0b

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-01 05:33:49.000000000', 'message': 'Adding port attribute in network parameter of boot.

Example is (network:[{‘port’:<uuid>}] ). The specified port will be used. A port who have already device_id can not be used to be boot.  This fix is for isolating functionalities between Quantum and Nova. There are no need update nova side if port model will be changed in future quantum model.  This function is for QuantumV2 api use only. Added port attribute in requested_network attribute. Fixes bug 10310961031096.

Change-Id: Id2c86228edb0c22f536f8b36a955c87870e9d98b
'}, {'created': '2012-08-01 05:34:45.000000000', 'message': 'Adding port attribute in network parameter of boot.

Example is (network:[{‘port’:<uuid>}] ). The specified port will be used
A port who have already device_id can not be used to be boot.
This fix is for isolating functionalities between Quantum and Nova.
There are no need update nova side if port model will be
changed in future quantum model.  This function is for QuantumV2 api use only.

commit_message:
Adding port attribute in network parameter of boot.

Example is (network:[{‘port’:<uuid>}] )
The specified port will be used.
A port who have already device_id can not be used to be boot.
This fix is for isolating functionalities between Quantum and Nova.
There are no need update nova side if port model will be changed
in future quantum model.  This function is for QuantumV2 api use only.
Added port attribute in requested_network attribute. Fixes bug 1031096.

Change-Id: Id2c86228edb0c22f536f8b36a955c87870e9d98b

commit_message:
xenapi: remove unnecessary json decoding of injected_files

The API is responsible for decoding JSON an XML content. Also, the
code decoded results weren't used since the code below it would use
the original data anyway.

Also, add a unit test for injected_files in the xenapi driver.

Change-Id: Ie96b301b0948f92dd90060eacba0db9ae940b952

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-15 11:43:24.000000000', 'message': 'Map internal exceptions in the nova style.

Fixes LP 1014687.

Adopt the nova idiom of internal exceptions mapped to their
corresponding HTTP reponse code in the FaultWrapper middleware,
and also inclusion of their detail message if declared safe for
external exposure.

Change-Id: I95a3c30466f6951e02f7a182545ff8db8fbecee8
'}]
commit_message:
Map internal exceptions in the nova style.

Fixes LP 1014687.

Adopt the nova idiom of internal exceptions mapped to their
corresponding HTTP reponse code in the FaultWrapper middleware,
and also inclusion of their detail message if declared safe for
external exposure.

Change-Id: I95a3c30466f6951e02f7a182545ff8db8fbecee8

Mark: Thanks for fixing this.

----

Magic is nice but I'm actually not entirely convinced the reverts_task_state decorator was/is a good idea. Some of our manager.py functions now have 4 decorators on them... so next time I go back and start modifying manager.py I'll have to remember to re-read all 4 of them to make sure I handle things just right. I do hope that we can limit the use of new nested decorators in this regard. Certainly not related to this commit though."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-15 13:19:55.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unnecessary try/finally from snapshot

Revert part of 0eb53c0 which reverted part of d8d7100 :-)

The idea was that now that @reverts_task_state handles unsetting the
task state, we now longer need the explicit exception handling here.

However, we still absolutely need to unset task_state on the happy
path.

Change-Id: I08dd212626886a643f0321780f6d8a30c3a967e6
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary try/finally from snapshot

Revert part of 0eb53c0 which reverted part of d8d7100 :-)

The idea was that now that @reverts_task_state handles unsetting the
task state, we now longer need the explicit exception handling here.

However, we still absolutely need to unset task_state on the happy
path.

Change-Id: I08dd212626886a643f0321780f6d8a30c3a967e6

"}, {'account_id': 1176, 'date': '2012-06-22 12:21:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 1176, 'date': '2012-06-22 12:30:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Trey and Chris,

Thanks for your reviews on this merge proposal on instance-type-extra-specs-extension.

The merge proposal is actually for augmenting the function in the compute_filter.py. Current upstream code simply compares capability and extra_specs and if they are different, it is rejected. The proposal extends it to various operations such as >= and <= to cover cases that happen in our HPC heterogeneous with OpenStack. The proposed code does not provide resource management function. (The actual management is done by hypervisor (nova-compute).) The blueprint can be found at http://wiki.openstack.org/InstanceTypeExtraSpecsExtension.

Note that the code that manages resource in compute/manager (not scheduler/manger) in the first few patches are now removed. So, currently, the code does not have any function that can be found in host_manager. 

It would be desirable and efficient if scheduler can update the resource usage right away instead of waiting for the updated information from compute node. This can be done if database schema is modified to include extra specs. We plan to do this with another merge proposal.

Joe,

Thanks for your review on our merge proposal.

The proposed merge is for different purpose than the HostAggreates. HostAggregates partitions hosts into aggregates so that a host among an aggregate can be selected.

In the proposed code, hosts are selected using a math function. So, for example, extra_specs can have many different conditions such as gpus>=2 and math_lib_version >= 2.1.3. Another extra_spec can have gpus >=4 and math_lib_version >= 1.3.2. In these examples, only two variables are used, but more than two variables can be used. The resulting "set" of hosts from different conditions can overlap as in the previous example. The proposal can handle any combination of such conditions easily. It is not easy to provide this functionality using HostAggregate especially when the number of variables is large.

So, if HostAggregate is implemented, the proposed merge is still needed to select a subset of the hosts in an easy way in an aggregate unless an aggregate has exactly the same feature list. Thus, these two are orthogonal. The proposed merge can be refactored once HostAggregate is merged.

Mark,

Thanks for your review on our merge proposal. Capabilities will be populated by hypervisor.

The json filter has a common function of comparing required resource and capabilities. However, the proposed merge needs to handle more operations such as handling numbers and strings differently. One solution is to extend the json filter but it may cause confusion to general json filter users. We thought a way to utilize the json filter following your comment, but realized the difference is still big, so we thought it would be cleaner approach to extend compute_filter that was originally designed to handle extra specs and leave json filter intact.

The information in the instance_type_extra_specs flag is to be handled by hypervisor. As described in the blueprint, each hypervisor may have a different way of managing the information, so, we decided to leave it out of the proposed code. In fact, another related proposal includes the code fo bare metal case, https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/general-bare-metal-provisioning-framework that uses the flag and manages the information there.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-22 12:34:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2012-07-23 08:59:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 34: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The commit message for this patch doesn't follow the HACKING file requirements. The first line should provide a brief summary of the commit, not simply list the name of the blueprint. The body of the commit message should not rely on external sources to provide details on the change. So please replace  "For more information, please refer" with an expanded description of what this does - eg perhaps some examples of usage of these new features

To quote the HACKING file

 "First, provide a brief summary (limited to 50 chars).

  The first line of the commit message should provide an accurate
  description of the change, not just a reference to a bug or
  blueprint. It must be followed by a single blank line.

  Following your brief summary, provide a more detailed description of
  the patch, manually wrapping the text at 72 characters. This
  description should provide enough detail that one does not have to
  refer to external resources to determine its high-level functionality."'}, {'account_id': 1176, 'date': '2012-07-23 17:08:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 35.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-23 17:28:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 35: Works for me

If I'm right (apologies if I'm not), then we should also have an additional test which would have caught this issue"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-14 16:42:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 37:

Oh, also - I checked and it appears this doesn't need a rebase"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-14 20:53:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 37: Do not merge

Vish and I just had a long debate about this. Let's see if I can summarize it

In essex, compute_filter matched extra_specs from instance types against the capabilities reported by the virt driver

In folsom, there was a desire to allow administrators to define per-host properties for extra_specs matching. This was first done with an additional_compute_capabilities flag and later replaced with host aggregate properties.

The summary is that capabilities.get('instance_type_extra_specs') is wrong and we should retain the old behavior

And also, since we now do exta_specs matching in the aggregate_instance_extra_specs filter, we should include support for the extra operators there too"}, {'account_id': 1176, 'date': '2012-08-14 21:10:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 37: (1 inline comment)

Thanks, Mark. New patch will be submitted.'}, {'account_id': 1176, 'date': '2012-08-14 21:41:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 38.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-14 21:55:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 38: Works for me

commit_message:
Added several operators on instance_type_extra_specs.

The following operators on instance_type_extra_specs were added in
compute_capabilities_filter.py:

    = (equal to or greater than as a number; same as vcpus case)
    == (equal to as a number)
    != (not equal to as a number)
    >= (greater than or equal to as a number)
    <= (less than or equal to as a number)
    s== (equal to as a string)
    s!= (not equal to as a string)
    s>= (greater than or equal to as a string)
    s> (greater than as a string)
    s<= (less than or equal to as a string)
    s< (less than as a string)
    <in> (substring)
    <or> (find one of these)

If the first word in the instance_type_extra_spec is not one of the
keywords above, it is ignored.

E.g.: ">= 5", "s== 2.1.0", "<in> gcc", and "<or> fpu <or> gpu"

For more information, please refer:
    blueprint instance-type-extra-specs-extension.

Change-Id: Ief23d00449798577c6910aaef85f0cba26323c61

subject: Return 400 in create snapshot with invalid volume id
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-15 10:05:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-cinder-merge/580/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-cinder-docs/504/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-cinder-pep8/543/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-cinder-python26/537/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-cinder-python27/544/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/7895/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2012-08-15 11:04:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Looks like diablo returns a 404 in this case...

duncan@z400-duncan:~$ nova volume-snapshot-create 000
Volume 0 could not be found. (HTTP 404)"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-08-15 11:48:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi Rongze,

I think 404 would be a more appropriate response code than 400 in this case.

Also, I introduced a new pattern in nova after cinder diverged from the nova codebase whereby the internal exception is mapped to its corresponding HTTP status code in the FaultWrapper middleware.

I've just ported this approach to cinder as:

  https://review.openstack.org/11398

This would address the current problem in a more general way.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 2481, 'date': '2012-08-15 12:03:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Eoghan, your work is nice. I will abandon my change.'}, {'account_id': 2481, 'date': '2012-08-15 12:25:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

subject: Return 201 on v2 image create
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-14 06:05:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-glance-merge/1766/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-glance-pep8/1878/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-glance-python26/1385/consoleFull : FAILURE
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-glance-python27/1389/consoleFull : FAILURE
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/7729/consoleFull : SUCCESS
"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-08-14 07:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

The change is obviously good, and 201 is certainly more fitting from the perspective of generally accepted RESTful idiom.

Unfortunately however, openstack is a bit all over the place in terms of following this idiom consistently - by contrast, the nova APIs tend to return either 202 or 200 on resource creation, as opposed to the more conventional 201.

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-08-14 11:54:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Just so you know, Nova uses 202 as it looks at the entity being created as the backend vm, not an image entity that only exists in the context of the API.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-08-14 17:25:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-08-14 17:25:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I missed quite a few things with patchset 1. The second addresses the gaps I left wide open.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-14 17:37:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/7782/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-08-15 00:27:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

http://httpcats.herokuapp.com/201'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-15 10:18:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Starting gate jobs.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-08-15 10:18:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Approved

@bcwaldon

BTW my comment about the nova 202/200 return referred to the general resource creation case, not just VM creation (e.g. volumes, security groups etc.), as discussed here:

  http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2012-July/000132.html

Cheers,

commit_message:
Enhancements to Cisco v2 meta-plugin

Implements blueprint cisco-v2-meta-plugin

This patch allows a stand alone plugin to be configured as a device sub-plugin.
(changes are contained within the cisco plugin only)

Change-Id: I4de53afc3a7e8c79ab8637fe04a90da1d1b05342

commit_message:
update python-quantumclient dependency to >=2.0

Nova should depend on a version of quantum client that includes
API v2.0 support.  That means the client version should be 2.0+ .

This was just pushed to PyPi today:

http://pypi.python.org/pypi/python-quantumclient/2.0

Change-Id: Ib9d997ceff92f2da6986d184b7b0da9e564800aa

I fully support the idea of preventing adding duplicate adresses, but I'd rather it added all of the addresses in a range that it could and just reported on each duplicate rather than stoppign with an exception when it gets to a dupilcate.

The use case I'm thinking of is extending / reparing an existing range."}, {'account_id': 5090, 'date': '2012-08-10 07:36:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I think this is incorrect behavior as default, I believe that if we can't perform requested action consistently then we must rollback all changes.  Also this can be discouraging when we have already registered addresses but with some different from requested parameters.

Maybe adding --force flag would be a good compromise?"}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2012-08-10 09:09:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Sorry , I think I misunderstood the code.  I hadn't realsied that you were passing the session in and it either adds all or none of the addresses in the range - I thought it was adding just up to the first failure.

On that basis I'll remove my -1, but a -"--ignore_dup" option would be a good addition (I don't think "force" is tehe right term here, as we'll still not be adding dupliacte addresses, just not stopping on them)'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-14 19:43:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:40:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:40:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

Starting gate jobs.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:56:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

commit_message:
Remove assigned, but unused variables from nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py

model_query already create session if it's not supplied in kwargs.
So there was no point in creating session and even not passing it to model_query.
Also, nobody even cares about 'specs' in volume_type_create.

Change-Id: Ic60dca9bbfcf908fa50a43424e7d93319b2f210b

subject: Add model support for DHCP lease expiration
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-merge/1231/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-docs/479/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-pep8/1099/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-python26/868/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-python27/869/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 141, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

model class has been updated and the test compares the expiration using the config param value'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:55:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks good to me, waiting for phase 2.

I will wait a bit before +2, just in case you can find some time to upload also the quantum.conf file updated with the default lease expiration. It's not necessary, but for consistency we should keep all the parameters set to their default values and commented in that file."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

I have one inline comment.
I am not sure if I understand correctly. A DHCP lease time is the amount of time that the client will have the IP address. This kind of contradicts the model that we are using. When a port is allocated a IP for the VM is either generated or specified. This IP is registered with the DHCP service. The DHCP service will allocate the IP address for a specific MAC address. As long as the port for the IP exists it should maintain the same IP address. 
At the end of the day the DHCP agent just needs to make sure that the client get the IP.
Maybe the fact that the recycled address is the next address allocated is the problem. 
I am yet to be convinced that there is a problem here.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

ok,
have a number of questions:
1. why would the tenant not shut down the vm?
2. in the subnet we have the dhcp_endabled flag. in addition to this we know that the port is active/up - the agent notifies the plugin that the port is up and running (forget the terminology). if this is the case why not prevent the tenant from doing what you have described? this can be further extended by ensuring that the port state is down if they want to chnage ip management. this can enable the dhcp agent to refresh.


if i understand correctly the solution would be to only allocate the ip once the timeout has expired? this would mean that there is a VM that is up and running that will not receive and ip address. no? sounds like a really odd scenario.

thanks
gary'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:55:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Here's why expirations are needed:

1) Tenant adds fixed_ip 192.168.1.2 to port A
2) vm A boots attached to port A
3) DHCP gives VM A the fixed IP
4) Tenant removes 192.168.1.2 from port A (but does not tell the guest VM to renew its leases).
5) Tenant creates port B which is allocated 192.168.1.2
6) vm B boots and sends DISCOVER message.  vm B should be given 192.168.1.2, but it will not take effect because 192.168.1.2 is already in use on the network."}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-python27/901/consoleFull : SUCCESS

I just noticed it has a dependency on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/10997/17...maybe until that patch goes in..jenkins wont pick this up...'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hopefully this should unblock jenkins.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Add model support for DHCP lease expiration

bug 1022804

This fix is phase 1 of a fix that to address re-allocation of a fixed_ip before
the DHCP lease expires.  The next phases will add RPC and recycling
support.

Change-Id: I3c907ade5cde562ff5a222bd97e56ffef367c722

"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:52:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I am not sure that this is the correct approach. 
If the problem is the network deletion then this can be addressed in another manner - for example if a network is deleted then all of the ports on the network can be deleted. 
I still do not understand why you cannot use the cast message for a network deletion?'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:52:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I was chatting with dhellman at lunch about this.  Can't really use cast because there can be multiple DHCP agents that need to release resources and update their runtime.  Seems like the processes should at least try to cooperate on this instead of force deleting resources that others are using.

What if it was changed to a retry loop.  The method would make N attempts  to delete the resource before the error is finally raised.  In the event that no ports opened/fixed ips allocated, the method would execute fast.  Is this more palatable?"}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:52:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Work In Progress

Updated to fix bugs that garyk found.'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:52:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

@garyk

The agent requires a subset of default Quantum notifications:

network.create.end
network.update.end
network.delete.start

subnet.create.end
subnet.update.end
subnet.update.start
subnet.update.end

port.create.end
port.update.end
port.delete.end'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:52:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:52:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Doesn't seem to work

Not sure if this is just my installation...'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:52:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: (5 inline comments)

Hi,
I have added in some inline comments.
I did some testing and things are looking good. I nonetheless have encountered 2 problems:

1. Deploy all from scratch on devstack (linux bridge). Deploy 2 vm's. The VM's get their IP's and all is good. The IP of the DHCP port is 10.0.0.2. I then set the subnet dhcp state as disabled. The IP 10.0.0.2 is returned the IP pool but it still answers pings.
2. If VMs are deployed when the dhcp state is disbaled when it is returned to enabled these VM's do not get IP's

I think that there may be edge cases when there are communication problems with the broker you may need to treat.

Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:52:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Convert DHCP from polling to RPC

blueprint non-polling-dhcp-impl

This requires a change to devstack/stack.sh.
See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/11278/ for the required changes.

Change-Id: I1ea22c8e1b80e630bcb83f27a31aaeef482aff6c

commit_message:
glance-scrubber.conf does not require db info

Remove database connection options from glance-scrubber.conf.

As of essex, the glance scrubber connects directly to the registry
API, it does not need to hit the database.

See https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/836381

Cherry picked from https://review.openstack.org/11294

Change-Id: Id08a5b64e84dd62303c928c052542693e190162c

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-python27/719/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2012-08-15 06:50:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(13 inline comments)

Some code cleanup :-)

Regarding the exception handling comment, I'd love to see more generic handling. I'll concede that this is subjective, but just trying to gauge opinions. Quantum isn't remotely the worst offender, but we have a lot of cases where exceptions get turned into other exceptions to no real benefit. My opinion is we should only have varied exception classes if A) We are actually going to make decisions on them or B) We're writing Java. 

Snark aside, since we don't want leaky abstractions, having the code that intercepts the handler worry about creating a generic message that can be returned to the client (whenever possible) seems more useful to me than trying to turn NvpExceptions into QuantumExceptions into Exceptions into HTTP status codes."}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2012-08-15 06:50:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2012-08-15 06:50:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (9 inline comments)

Hi Matt, Thanks for the review and comments. Just as a side note we have a new version of the api_client (with a lot of improvements, load balancing to multiple controllers rather than just fail over, etc) which we plan to add as an external dependency outside of the plugin shortly. 

Regarding the exception handling we do change NvpExceptions into QuantumExceptions but not into HTTP status codes (can you point on where?). In  api_client we do turn HTTP status codes to NvpExceptions to QuantumExceptions. 

We only return a generic QuantumExceptions if the exception was an NvpException so generic client api code can handle them properly. Please, let me know if I'm off base in what you are saying. 

Thanks again, 

Aaron"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-15 06:50:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
Use event.listen instead of dep. listeners kwarg.

The listeners kwarg is deprecated in SQLAlchemy 0.7.0. Since Keystone
is using latest SQLAlchemy, use the new event.listen() API instead.

Fixes bug 1031405.

Change-Id: I2d19ba4e76cf22bd4e81442a063cf01466b4e1f8

commit_message:
Fix path to example extension implementation

fixes bug 1032118

In class ExtensionManager
The path for example implemetation of an extension should be
nova/tests/api/openstack/volume/extensions/foxinsocks.py
instead of
nova/tests/api/openstack/extensions/foxinsocks/extension.py

which no longer exists.

This affects the documentation at:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api/nova.api.openstack.extensions.html#nova.api.openstack.extensions.ExtensionManager

Change-Id: I1dbe3c25eea08ada6fe21ebe6186ef4d867e122b

commit_message:
Re-establish block storage connections anytime a VM is hard rebooted.
The code path utilized when "start_guests_on_host_boot" is set ultimately
results in a hard reboot, which is also accounted for via this patch.

Bug 1001088

Change-Id: Ia275fe509df0ce6116e14af79067bd79f4851778

commit_message:
Implement network association in OS API

Networks are associated with projects automatically during launch
of an instance. The network is chosen rather randomly.
This commit adds support for association of given network and project.

DocImpact - when this lands, need to update openstack-manuals repo:
doc/src/docbkx/openstack-api-site/src/wadls/compute-api/src/ext/os-networks.wadl

Implements: blueprint os-api-network-associate
Change-Id: Iafaf4a5ae3d3e16a6c649f1d7850fceba732efab

commit_message:
Table filtering fixes.

Prevents server-side filtering when javascript is enabled as a
temporary fix for 954814.

Makes filtering properly update the footer count and display an
empty row for both tables and the new resource browser.

Change-Id: Ib7a0f21a4c11182b65cd6f80d70b5aadda6c3cf8
