revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-10 11:11:35.000000000', 'message': 'Sync with latest version of openstack.common.notifier

Changes since last sync:

 - Add multiple-driver support to the notifier api.
 - fix bug lp:1019348,update openstack-common to support pep8 1.3.
 - Fix missing gettextutils in several modules.
 - Fix line length for pep8 compliance after cloning into other projects
 - Switch common files to using jsonutils.

Change-Id: If2cea51761ae14d188861518c567abdf0d8a0649
'}, {'created': '2012-08-10 11:15:13.000000000', 'message': 'Sync with latest version of openstack.common.notifier

Changes since last sync:

 - Add multiple-driver support to the notifier api.
 - fix bug lp:1019348,update openstack-common to support pep8 1.3.
 - Fix missing gettextutils in several modules.
 - Fix line length for pep8 compliance after cloning into other projects
 - Switch common files to using jsonutils.

Also add notifier and local to openstack-common.conf since we appear
to have forgotten to add them when they were imported.

commit_message:
Sync with latest version of openstack.common.notifier

Changes since last sync:

 - Add multiple-driver support to the notifier api.
 - fix bug lp:1019348,update openstack-common to support pep8 1.3.
 - Fix missing gettextutils in several modules.
 - Fix line length for pep8 compliance after cloning into other projects
 - Switch common files to using jsonutils.

Also add notifier and local to openstack-common.conf since we appear
to have forgotten to add them when they were imported.

Change-Id: If2cea51761ae14d188861518c567abdf0d8a0649

commit_message:
Add min_ram and min_disk to v2 images schema

The min_ram and min_disk image attributes are stored in the db, so
we need to expose them as core image attributes to preserve
backwards-compatibility with the v1 Images API.

Related to bp api-2

Change-Id: If2afa1f171aa6c4f07052225592d216f7e09ca90

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-10 12:13:38.000000000', 'message': "Update rbd store to allow copy-on-write clones

This is in preparation for cinder blueprint
efficient-volumes-from-images. If the same rbd cluster is used by
glance and cinder, a new volume can be created as a copy-on-write
clone by the ceph cluster rather than downloading all the data from
glance.

Since bp api-v2-store-access is implemented, make the location for the
rbd store more specific, so cinder can check that it's accessing the
same backend as glance. fsid is a unique identifier for a Ceph cluster.

Within a cluster, the full specification of an rbd image includes
pool, image name, and optionally snapshot. Creating a copy-on-write
clone is only possible in rbd on a protected snapshot, so after
uploading an image to rbd, create a snapshot and protect
it. Protection means it can't be deleted until it is unprotected, so
you can't accidentally render any clones unusable by removing their
parent. More details can be found at
http://ceph.com/docs/master/dev/rbd-layering/.

For backwards compatibility, only use these new features if they are
supported by the installed librados and librbd python bindings. Otherwise
fallback to the previous location specifier which only includes image
id, since cloning won't work anyway.

Since the location parsing is now a bit more complicated, add unit
tests for it.

Change-Id: I9711702276d966f88284fae44f9531b992cdd06f
"}, {'created': '2012-08-10 19:27:41.000000000', 'message': "Update rbd store to allow copy-on-write clones

This is in preparation for cinder blueprint
efficient-volumes-from-images. If the same rbd cluster is used by
glance and cinder, a new volume can be created as a copy-on-write
clone by the ceph cluster rather than downloading all the data from
glance.

Since bp api-v2-store-access is implemented, make the location for the
rbd store more specific, so cinder can check that it's accessing the
same backend as glance. fsid is a unique identifier for a Ceph cluster.

Within a cluster, the full specification of an rbd image includes
pool, image name, and optionally snapshot. Creating a copy-on-write
clone is only possible in rbd on a protected snapshot, so after
uploading an image to rbd, create a snapshot and protect
it. Protection means it can't be deleted until it is unprotected, so
you can't accidentally render any clones unusable by removing their
parent. Add a new exception, InUseByStore, to handle a snapshot or
image that's still protected or otherwise in use.

More details can be found at
http://ceph.com/docs/master/dev/rbd-layering/.

For backwards compatibility, only use these new features if they are
supported by the installed librados and librbd python bindings. Otherwise
fallback to the previous location specifier which only includes image
id, since cloning won't work anyway.

Since the location parsing is now a bit more complicated, add unit
tests for it.

Change-Id: I9711702276d966f88284fae44f9531b992cdd06f
"}]
commit_message:
Update rbd store to allow copy-on-write clones

This is in preparation for cinder blueprint
efficient-volumes-from-images. If the same rbd cluster is used by
glance and cinder, a new volume can be created as a copy-on-write
clone by the ceph cluster rather than downloading all the data from
glance.

Since bp api-v2-store-access is implemented, make the location for the
rbd store more specific, so cinder can check that it's accessing the
same backend as glance. fsid is a unique identifier for a Ceph cluster.

Within a cluster, the full specification of an rbd image includes
pool, image name, and optionally snapshot. Creating a copy-on-write
clone is only possible in rbd on a protected snapshot, so after
uploading an image to rbd, create a snapshot and protect
it. Protection means it can't be deleted until it is unprotected, so
you can't accidentally render any clones unusable by removing their
parent. Add a new exception, InUseByStore, to handle a snapshot or
image that's still protected or otherwise in use.

More details can be found at
http://ceph.com/docs/master/dev/rbd-layering/.

For backwards compatibility, only use these new features if they are
supported by the installed librados and librbd python bindings. Otherwise
fallback to the previous location specifier which only includes image
id, since cloning won't work anyway.

Since the location parsing is now a bit more complicated, add unit
tests for it.

Change-Id: I9711702276d966f88284fae44f9531b992cdd06f

commit_message:
Filter out None values from v2 API image entity

Prevent core image attributes with None values from being returned
to v2 API clients. Most attribute schemas are of type 'string' and
returning None is invalid.

Fixes bug 1034790

Change-Id: I2885cabf14307e46ff711bdabfcd3ff3253e6628

commit_message:
Make swift_store_admin_tenants a ListOpt.

The swift_store_admin_tenants config option should have never
been a boolean opt. Actually using the config in this state will
cause glance-api to fail to startup.

Fixes LP Bug #1035471.

Change-Id: Ie800f6ee7cf1b8d863d5e8e8ac41e8ed36f345f1

commit_message:
Compute restart causes period of network 'blackout'

Fixes bug 1034401

When a compute service is restarted each instance running on the
host has its iptables rules built and applied sequentially during
the host init stage. The impact of this, especially on a host
running many instances, can be observed as a period where some
instances are not accessible as the existing iptables rules have
been torn down and not yet re-applied.

The presented work-around for this is a configurable/flagged deferred
mode that prevents the application of the iptables rules until all
instances on the host had been initialised then the rules for all
instances are applied all at once preventing a 'blackout' period.

Change-Id: I0da90d07e54225fb63f3884897fb00a6027cd537

commit_message:
Default behavior should restrict admins to tenant for volumes.

  * NOTE: This is a port from cinder to nova volumes
  * Now to view all volumes or volume snapshots across
    all tenants you need to include the all_tenants=1
    GET param in your api request.
  * Fixes remaining issues blocking bug #967882

Change-Id: I7fe15e792b62e59973c7faa2cf1c52929ae5864f

commit_message:
Update python-glanceclient to allow anything < v2

The python-glanceclient pythonic API shouldn't break until v2 is
released, so let's allow anything up to that known point.

Alters the way test exceptions are constructed so that we're
not dependent on the internals of how 3rd party libraries
handle their exceptions while still being able to use them
for real testing in Horizon.

Fixes bug 1035511

Change-Id: I9a4379a19d5d6dee9d2349a73d9321def45ad78d

commit_message:
Remove inaccurate note re return code compute-api

fixes bug 973685

The note this patch removes was causing confusion, as it appeared
to insinuate that not using a 404 return code for non-existing pages
in the compute api was a bug. Actually the empty set behaviour is
normal and expected.

This is an old bug - feedback welcome :)

Change-Id: I6b2a273fbb0d25c86db0da40f2584fd2c7648585

This is the beginning of a refactoring of the section on creating
images. This change describes how to create QCOW2 and raw images,
using CentOS as an example.

I would like to eventually remove the existing docs on creating a
raw image, since it's out of date, but I wanted to get this
replacement doc get in for review first.

Change-Id: Ic4564833e453ee34deafedb3f5621d74624aef20

commit_message:
Document how to create qcow and raw images.

This is the beginning of a refactoring of the section on creating
images. This change describes how to create QCOW2 and raw images,
using CentOS as an example.

I would like to eventually remove the existing docs on creating a
raw image, since it's out of date, but I wanted to get this
replacement doc get in for review first.

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/9486

Change-Id: Ic4564833e453ee34deafedb3f5621d74624aef20

commit_message:
Refactor v2 images resource unit tests

* Add _fixture() helper method for generating image fixtures
* Simplify some tests that were asserting things they didnt need to
* Remove unused glance.common.exception import

Change-Id: I5eec5430df2ca0867b21fcfda0586ef5273061f3

[{'created': '2012-08-10 11:14:19.000000000', 'message': "Sync with latest version of openstack.common.log

Changes since last sync:

 - Install a qualified except hook.
 - Remove code to clear basicConfig root log handlers
 - don't throw exceptions if %(color)s tag is used
 - fix bug lp:1019348,update openstack-common to support pep8 1.3.
 - Fix missing gettextutils in several modules.
 - Switch common files to using jsonutils.

Change-Id: I430caf24526e571688c78f3cdd9f9453f5d525c4
"}]
commit_message:
Sync with latest version of openstack.common.log

Changes since last sync:

 - Install a qualified except hook.
 - Remove code to clear basicConfig root log handlers
 - don't throw exceptions if %(color)s tag is used
 - fix bug lp:1019348,update openstack-common to support pep8 1.3.
 - Fix missing gettextutils in several modules.
 - Switch common files to using jsonutils.

Change-Id: I430caf24526e571688c78f3cdd9f9453f5d525c4

commit_message:
Sync with latest version of openstack.common.timeutils

Changes since last since:

 - Remove unused imports
 - Fix utcnow_ts to return UTC timestamp
 - Add nova time util functions to timeutils
 - Replace datetime.utcnow with timeutils.utcnow

Change-Id: Ic98bfc9655edad8f7319daafede192534f68a1a5

commit_message:
move the correct veth into the netns for the LB

bug 1035649

This fix moves the correct device into the namespace and improves the test
to ensure the proper device was moved.  The previous generic check
failed to catch an error during refactoring.

Change-Id: Ifa2e2bb97dc923549d00b1750c61a22e139647d7

commit_message:
Add netns to support overlapping address ranges

blueprint: dhcp-overlapping-ips

This change uses linux network namespaces to isolate dhcp interfaces so
that tenant network IP address ranges can properly overlap.

Change-Id: Iaa07e7c38d0813d07c3405884e513276e43e2afd

commit_message:
To simulate the real workloads, the objects to be uploaded should be created in the random sizes, which are bounded (lower_object_size and upper_object_size) by the user input.

Change-Id: I4f0352cce2686f11509f8ccb831834548ec889ab

commit_message:
Speed up the downloading if APT_FAST=True is set in localrc.

Fixes Bug1025235. Add a repository for apt-fast.

Change-Id: If13e0ccca747c8d36db38ed32118d025cfb19c11

commit_message:
libvirt driver: set driver name for xen

This patch sets correct driver name for xen libvirt.xml, to be able to
use qcow2 type images with xen.

Change-Id: Id984e0c431b6fc743a39e6e6f3dc3eb289fbb43a

(5 inline comments)

Hi, see inline comments.
My other comment is a plea to put the filesystem rendering of the metadata service into nova/api/metadata .  The goal of config-drive-v2 is that it is a filesystem rendering of the metadata.  When things are added to the metadata service, I want them to "automatically" end up here.

This is less likely to occur if the 2 renderings are separate.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-08-08 19:35:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

Thank you. its looking good.
I will offer to do mtools code for the vfat population if desired.  I think that is even generally safer than mounting and populating as root (although other than being root, that should be pretty safe).

We should definitely default to iso9660.
However, defaulting to iso9660 breaks the config-drive-v1 spec.  If we're willy-nilly breaking that, then I suggest we go ahead and put injected files in /files rather than top level directory."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2012-08-09 04:27:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

seems like files should be under openstack/version/files (or personalities?) and probably the path from personalities shouldn't be used but should be stored as some sort of json representation

files.json:
[
{
  "path': "/home/ubuntu/.ssh/authorized_keys",
  "owner": "ubuntu",
  "group": "ubuntu",
  "permissions": "600",
  "data": "a.blob"
}
...
]


a.blob -> data for the file

Then cloud-init can do the actual file creation and injection.  Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-08-09 17:36:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

'}, {'created': '2012-08-07 11:18:30.000000000', 'message': "Phase 1 of implementing config drive v2

This is a work in progress. So far in this review:

 - implements a helper to create new-style config drives. These
   config drives can be VFAT or ISO9660, but currently only ISO9660
   is actually generated by the libvirt driver.

 - the config drives contain all the injected files, as well as
   everything returned from the ec2 style metadata service, in
   _all_ available versions.

 - the v1 functionality of specifying an image from glance to have
   the files injected into is supported, although the code that
   implements this is refactored heavily.

 - there are some simple unit tests which probably need more done
   to them.

 - this has been tested with unit tests on my machine, but I haven't
   had a chance to give it a try in a real environment yet.

Partially implements bp config-drive-v2.

Change-Id: I210fa4dd7d8d6be398a46b30a0d46b960e22d6b0

commit_message:
Config drive v2

This is the first cut of config drive v2. Some points to note:

 - implements a helper to create new-style config drives. These
   config drives can be VFAT or ISO9660, this is controlled by
   a flag. The current default is ISO9660.

 - the config drives contain all the injected files, as well as
   everything returned from the ec2 style metadata service. Only
   the most recent version of the ec2 metadata is used, but future
   versions will appear as well.

 - the v1 functionality of specifying an image from glance to have
   the files injected into is dropped.

 - the location for file injection is now a directory named
   openstack/files, not the root level of the filesystem. Filename
   mapping is in the openstack metadata files.

 - the default format for the config drive is iso9660, although
   the previous vfat is available with a flag change.

 - includes the first version of an openstack metadata format.

 - there are some simple unit tests which probably need more done
   to them.

Partially implements bp config-drive-v2.

Change-Id: I210fa4dd7d8d6be398a46b30a0d46b960e22d6b0

commit_message:
Remove v1 code from quantum-server

bp remove-v1-related-code

Removes API, DB, and test code that is used only for Quantum v1 API,
which is no longer supported.

Includes removal of v1 code for sample, ovs, linuxbridge and ryu plugin.

Nicira and Cisco plugins will be handled outside of this patchset.

Change-Id: Id34dc7229bb7b399b5cfd4602dbc8d5ee4e8de61

commit_message:
Use container_format and disk_format as-is in v2

Rather than force a painful migration to type and format, use
container_format and disk_format as they are in the v1 API for v2
since there isn't a clear path to an interoperable alternative.

Related to bp api-2

Change-Id: If8161390abf17961885e5c02e38d635b287aeca4

commit_message:
Don't accept key_name if not enabled

partially implements blueprint disable-server-extensions

moves filling out key_name variable behind conditional only
used when os-keypairs is enabled.

Adds unit tests to ensure this behaves as expected

(Remove debugging that was left in)

Change-Id: I87ce041c2093c93a1a2456ef51357593e9de0681

commit_message:
Key min_count, max_count, ret_res_id off of ext.

Implements part of blueprint disable-server-extensions

Adds a new extension descriptor callsed os-multiple-create. Modifies
the min_count, max_count, and return_reservation_id parameters to
server create to only be allowed if the extension is enabled.

Change-Id: Iaca009588d6c824e0852a060787d2a4cb9614278

commit_message:
Key availability_zone in create server off of ext.

Implements part of blueprint disable-server-extensions

Adds a new extension descriptor for availability_zone and makes sure
that availability_zone is only accepted in the create server request
if the extension is enabled.

Change-Id: I326b26c4741ffa6a8b594be26d0cd22d032a6162

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-10 22:21:15.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure reservations is initialized

In compute API, _delete() could reference reservations before it was
ever assigned, if the call to _update() or to QUOTAS.reserve() raised
an exception--the exception handlers test to see if reservations is
set, and if so, rolls the reservations back.  This patch makes sure
the reservations variable is initialized to None before entering the
try: block.

Change-Id: I7e344074d8fd75b371d78abf8fd15b6f84023cef
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure reservations is initialized

In compute API, _delete() could reference reservations before it was
ever assigned, if the call to _update() or to QUOTAS.reserve() raised
an exception--the exception handlers test to see if reservations is
set, and if so, rolls the reservations back.  This patch makes sure
the reservations variable is initialized to None before entering the
try: block.

Change-Id: I7e344074d8fd75b371d78abf8fd15b6f84023cef

commit_message:
Don't accept scheduler_hints if not enabled

partially implements blueprint disable-server-extensions

moves the filling out of the code behind a conditional to
ensure this data is only passed if the extension is actually
enabled

Change-Id: If866eb87c9e6189b6948cb37f0cb8f5e26c8cced

Now its possible to detect if an extenion is loaded, wouldn't it be possible to detect which extensions have a methiod to process optional arguments to server create and call them in a more generic manner ?

commit_message:
Key user_data in create server off of extension

Implements part of blueprint disable-server-extensions

Adds a new extension descriptor for user_data and makes sure that
user_data is only accepted in the create server request if the
extension is enabled.

Change-Id: I7aef0ebe569da841adbf380d5695c9029fb3b002

commit_message:
Key block_device_mapping off of volume extension

partially implements blueprint disable-server-extensions

Instead of creating a child controller for boot from volume,
key the post parameter of of the os-volumes extension.

Change-Id: I0dd233c2ae12a09d6fc59c49042c2f8b83f3fdba

commit_message:
Make sure ec2 mapping raises proper exceptions

The get commands in the db layer were constructing InstanceNotFound,
VolumeNotFound, and SnapshotNotFound with imporoper kwargs. This
fixes them to raise properly and adds a test to verify that the
exception formatting succeeded.

Fixes bug 1035375

Change-Id: I05a5bb57c047ca2b2f086c70ad12a640f51b2d3a

commit_message:
General host aggregates part 2

Partially implements blueprint general-host-aggregates: Scheduler Filter
* Add AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter
* change db.aggregate_get_by_host to return a list of aggregates
  instead of the first aggregate
* Add optional key filter to db.aggregate_get_by_host along with test
* Add db.aggregate_metadata_get_by_host to get host aggregate metadata
* add optional key filter to db.aggregate_metadata_get_by_host
* Add AggregateTypeAffinityFilter

Change-Id: I4a3061276cc3b0c5c695eaf973b773183b3c4f4b

commit_message:
Make receiver spawning in impl_zmq more robust/clean.

The receiver spawning had some faulty and complex logic
which this patch improves. The old logic was logging detection
of a zmq-receiver socket, although the code was also launching
a receiver daemon. It was also doing dirty things such
as intentionally doing a return to trigger a finally block.

Change-Id: Ic044710679c43753240a2b9d909088af5317cbf4

commit_message:
Use default route to find HOST_IP

When running devstack, nova moves the host ip from eth0 onto the
bridge. This causes devstack to fail on the second run unless you
explicitly set HOST_IP in localrc.

This patch searches for an ip on the interface that is used for
the default route. This will be eth0 (or en0) in most cases, but
it will search br100 instead if nova has moved the ip, since it
moves the default route as well.

It also will filter out ips from the potential list that are part
of the fixed range and floating range if the netaddr library is
installed. This allows us to find the proper ip even if we have
accidentally left a floating ip or fixed ip on the bridge.

Change-Id: I13288e53ee2786c5ae0edb3f9ab457be8303f1f6

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-08 20:48:22.000000000', 'message': 'Handle communication failures cleanly

Expand exceptions to cover more failures cases. This adds
CommunicationFailure to represent any failures while attempting
to communicate with the remote endpoint. This also adds a new base
exception class BaseException which should be used for all non-HTTP
related failures.

Change-Id: Ie3e1d45c520d816a3f491a85fde94a6c4edf295e
'}, {'created': '2012-08-10 20:30:30.000000000', 'message': 'Handle communication failures cleanly

Expand exceptions to cover more failures cases. This adds
CommunicationFailure to represent any failures while attempting
to communicate with the remote endpoint. This also adds a new base
exception class BaseException which should be used for all non-HTTP
related failures.

Change-Id: Ie3e1d45c520d816a3f491a85fde94a6c4edf295e
'}]
commit_message:
Handle communication failures cleanly

Expand exceptions to cover more failures cases. This adds
CommunicationFailure to represent any failures while attempting
to communicate with the remote endpoint. This also adds a new base
exception class BaseException which should be used for all non-HTTP
related failures.

Change-Id: Ie3e1d45c520d816a3f491a85fde94a6c4edf295e

commit_message:
Use openstack.common.notifier.

- Update openstack.common.log to use it (and fixes #1030078 for cinder as
  well so we can get review I9d4251b4292188c0174ebac1dcd98318df44c0e3
  working).
- Don't use openstack.common.context but our own just yet.

Change-Id: I10feda623788a3b2418cad6bf55cbdb860ba8ee7

Changes since last sync:

 - Modifies _is_opt_registered fcn to check for duplicate opts
 - cfg: Fix typo in documentation
 - Update common code to support pep 1.3. bug 1014216
 - Use 'is not None' instead of '!= None'
 - Add support to include config aliases
 - allow empty config values

Change-Id: Ibe31c90a71e58bdea2f947a039f2c2dce2749c14
"}]
commit_message:
Sync with latest version of openstack.common.cfg

Changes since last sync:

 - Modifies _is_opt_registered fcn to check for duplicate opts
 - cfg: Fix typo in documentation
 - Update common code to support pep 1.3. bug 1014216
 - Use 'is not None' instead of '!= None'
 - Add support to include config aliases
 - allow empty config values

Change-Id: Ibe31c90a71e58bdea2f947a039f2c2dce2749c14

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-01 15:19:27.000000000', 'message': "Making security group refresh more specific

Fixes bug 1029495

The trigger_members_refresh method in compute.api.py specifies
a group id in the call to refresh_security_group_members. This
is just the last group id seen and ignores the fact that a
refresh may impact members of multiple groups.

This is masked by the fact that on the host the group id is
ignored and all instances have their security rules refreshed
regardless of if they are part of the changed group or not.

This change modifies the logic surrounding refreshes so we send
a refresh request for each instance which is affected by a
security group change, this ensures we aren't spending time
refreshing unaffected instances and also removes the possibility
of refreshing an instance multiple times if it is a member of
more than one group.

Change-Id: Iec98e9aed818fdc4ecc88c8dcdd4ee5fa9386e00

commit_message:
Making security group refresh more specific

Fixes bug 1029495

The trigger_members_refresh method in compute.api.py specifies
a group id in the call to refresh_security_group_members. This
is just the last group id seen and ignores the fact that a
refresh may impact members of multiple groups.

This is masked by the fact that on the host the group id is
ignored and all instances have their security rules refreshed
regardless of if they are part of the changed group or not.

This change modifies the logic surrounding refreshes so we send
a refresh request for each instance which is affected by a
security group change, this ensures we aren't spending time
refreshing unaffected instances and also removes the possibility
of refreshing an instance multiple times if it is a member of
more than one group.

Also changed to be instance-centric is the refresh carried out
when a rule is added/removed to a security group.

Change-Id: Iec98e9aed818fdc4ecc88c8dcdd4ee5fa9386e00

commit_message:
Client-side SSL Connection

This allows a user to pass a cert and a key to use in HTTPS
connections. The flags --cert-file and --key-file are added
to the CLI.

Addiionally, update the debug curl logging to print --cacert and
-k when ca_file and insecure are set.

Related to bp glance-client-parity.

Change-Id: Ibaea51419a903afb7939a6b5b848f7a6667893bf

commit_message:
Moves security group functionality into extension

partially implements blueprint disable-server-extensions

This patch adds an output extension for security group output
and modifies the servers code to only allow security groups
to be specified if the os-security-groups extension is
enabled.

Duplicated security group functionality was removed from the
createserverext extension, it is now a duplicate of the servers
endpoint. The boot_from_volume extension was also changed
to inherit the servers functionality so that security_groups
will continue to work. The block_device_mapping code will be
modified in a subsequent patch.

Tests were added for new functionality, and existing tests were
modified slightly. The disk_config extension was modified to be
a bit more lenient so the data for it doesn't need to be mocked
out in other tests.

Change-Id: I59bd985d68b85ce6926cde85fbc38cfad4e75f4c

commit_message:
Call stop_servers() in direct_url func tests

The recently-added direct_url tests aren't spinning down their
api servers. This was causing arbitrary failures when running
tests in jenkins and smokestack.

Change-Id: I06293fdec8449c15fe993653157c327c8a7e8418

commit_message:
maint: compare singletons with 'is' not '=='

Looks like newer pep8 will get checks for these:
https://github.com/jcrocholl/pep8/commit/b04975dc
Using 'is' is slightly faster anyway :)

Change-Id: Id14951791991cca919b54ed747ff99fb66aa3352

because the OpenShift repositories were too busy.  I submitted this upstream
in:

  https://github.com/openshift/crankcase/pull/336

and it was merged.

'}]
commit_message:
Remove crankcase patch since fix was merged upstream

Added a patch to force yum to retry indefinately on crankcase builds
because the OpenShift repositories were too busy.  I submitted this upstream
in:

  https://github.com/openshift/crankcase/pull/336

and it was merged.

As a result, removing this workaround.

Change-Id: I26e0a162d5cfb4bc23843c93678318ff21610973
Signed-off-by: Steven Dake <sdake@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Create unique volumes_dir for testing.

Updates several Nova volume test classes so that we create a
unique volumes_dir for testing. This avoids polluting the source
tree with fake volume UUID's when running tests.

Note: I opted to go utils.tempdir in test_volume (which seemed
cleaner). I did not however use utils.tempdir in the other
test modules since it would have required a good be more
reformatting effort...

Change-Id: I24a53c28c52156750cf65942639af0b15fbeefc1

subject: Added support for pickling datetime for rpc calls.
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-10 18:37:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-merge/423/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-pep8/291/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-python26/291/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-python27/291/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2012-08-10 18:37:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Correct, microseconds are not supported.

And this is only used in nova-to-nova performance calls. Not external (another patch pending that will use this).'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2012-08-10 18:37:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I thought this had to land before I could sync with nova? Otherwise Jenkins will puke, no?'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-10 18:37:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

(1 inline comment)

Alrighty, can you link to the other patch once you've posted it?  It would be nice to review them together.  The nova patch could include this update to openstack-common and just say "pending this change going into openstack-common first".'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-10 18:37:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't think Jenkins has any idea about whether nova is in sync with openstack-common.  I would just include this change in nova/openstack/common/timeutils.py with your other patch to nova.  Just leave a note that it shouldn't be merged yet because stuff is supposed to land in common first.

I was thinking about this some more and from a security perspective, I'm still not fully comfortable with using pickle and rpc.  It's not a vulnerability, but could increase the potential damage that could be done if someone compromised a message broker.  They would have a way to get arbitrary code executed on other nodes."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-10 18:37:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

We've avoided using pickle so far and I'd really like to avoid letting that get into rpc.  It's Python specific, and rpc is used to generate messages that may be consumed by other programming languages (notifications).

So what's wrong with strtime()/parse_strtime()?  Doesn't that include microseconds?"}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2012-08-10 18:37:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Replaced with
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/11173/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-10 18:37:19.000000000', 'message': 'Added support for pickling datetime for rpc calls.

Prevents the need to fragile string parse while maintaining
microseconds (needed for performance measurements).

Change-Id: I25bc543a79e8a4fa7c7301014a280c56704388de
'}]
commit_message:
Added support for pickling datetime for rpc calls.

Prevents the need to fragile string parse while maintaining
microseconds (needed for performance measurements).

Change-Id: I25bc543a79e8a4fa7c7301014a280c56704388de

commit_message:
SSL Certificate Validation

This adds support for validation of ssl certs returned by remote
servers over SSL. The --ca-file param represents the CA cert used
to sign the remote server's cert. Use --insecure if the remote
server is using a self-signed cert or you don't have the CA cert.

Related to bp glance-client-parity

Change-Id: I45253a6e2d88da599addfcc464571e62ae920166

commit_message:
Drop unfinshed parts of v2 API

The v2 API will be implemented over time as the spec develops. We
shouldn't implement anything that we aren't 100% behind. This drops
all of the things that we aren't in love with:
* Drop access records and related schemas
* Drop owner attribute from image

Related to bp api-2

Change-Id: Ieef2c141282e7018d56e79aee8f20af0542af25b

commit_message:
Adds a clarifying statement re: partition meaning

fixes bug 1033903

Have encountered several people who have been confused into creating some
huge amount of (physical) disk partitions by the text following this
change. So the idea here is to add a clarifying note so there is no
ambiguity about what "partition" means in this section.

Change-Id: Ieea81d8f1aad8ddf0f31697d4c2cd54a8b0c288d

commit_message:
Enable client V2 to download images

Added the CLI option image-download to download an image via API V2.
Added utility function to save an image.
Added common iterator to validate the checksum.

Related to bp glance-client-v2

Change-Id: I0247f5a3462142dc5e9f3dc16cbe00c8e3d42f42

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-10 16:55:46.000000000', 'message': "Add import_opt() method to ConfigOpts

Related to blueprint cfg-global-object

When using the global config object pattern, you often have modules
which define options that are referenced in other options.

So, for example if module A defined option 'foo' and module be needed
to reference that option, you might do:

  import A
  print CONF.foo

However, this makes it entirely unclear to the casual reader why
module A was imported.

Nova has a flags.DECLARE() function that helps with this problem
by allowing you to do:

  flags.DECLARE('foo', 'A')

The function simply imports module A and checks that the 'foo'
option is now defined in the global config object.

This is fine, but it is also implicit that this function applies
to the global config object. Instead, let's do the following:

  CONF.import_opt('foo', 'A')

Change-Id: I7b98f5be71068bbde70cc0eab991eaebb577de52
"}]
commit_message:
Add import_opt() method to ConfigOpts

Related to blueprint cfg-global-object

When using the global config object pattern, you often have modules
which define options that are referenced in other options.

So, for example if module A defined option 'foo' and module be needed
to reference that option, you might do:

  import A
  print CONF.foo

However, this makes it entirely unclear to the casual reader why
module A was imported.

Nova has a flags.DECLARE() function that helps with this problem
by allowing you to do:

  flags.DECLARE('foo', 'A')

The function simply imports module A and checks that the 'foo'
option is now defined in the global config object.

This is fine, but it is also implicit that this function applies
to the global config object. Instead, let's do the following:

  CONF.import_opt('foo', 'A')

Change-Id: I7b98f5be71068bbde70cc0eab991eaebb577de52

Gary'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-10 16:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-python26/466/testReport : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-python27/467/testReport : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-08-10 16:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (7 inline comments)

Ok, after looking through the code I know have a better understanding of what you're shooting for, and I better understand the disconnect between this patch and what I was thinking this patch was :)

Based on the spec, I think our main goal here is eliminating polling.  But the only reason the old plugins actually needed to poll was to be "notified" about changes to a port state (e.g., admin status, etc) made via the API at some point other than when the VM boots.  This patch (as we talked about on IRC briefly) doesn't seem to handle that case.  

My current thinking here is: 
1) we can use the notifications stuff that Yong is added so that agents can have a standard interface for learning when a port is updated (ideally, the set of notifications sent to an agent could be filtered at the source to include only the ports they want notifications for). 
2) the process of grabbing information about a port can be done via the standard quantum APIs, rather than designing and testing a second method for fetching such info.  

I think this issue is really important, so I think we should discuss it a bit at the meeting on monday, and potentially have dedicated discussion involving interested parties (including folks developing the dhcp and l3-agents).  I've mentioned the same thing to Yong with his notifications stuff.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-08-10 16:25:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

-1 until we have a chance to discuss more."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-10 16:25:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I would recommend using versioned RPC APIs.  Take a look at rpc/dispatcher.py and rpc/proxy.py, as well as their usage in nova."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-10 16:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-10 16:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (7 inline comments)

Hi,
I have addressed the inline comments that you have made and I would also like to address the comments that you have made regarding the "patch" in general. The purpose of the patch is to remove the database polling and access from the agents and to make the agents more scalable. The current state is that when a tap device is created on the agent the agent will request the port details and configure accordingly.
I am currently working on adding the code for the the agents to get a notification that port/network status has changed (I looked at the OVS and LB V2 plugins with my tests they did not treat this). I do not think that the notifications code is a good solution for this problem - I do not see how the plugin can know which agent has the relevant details - which implies that a broadcast will have to be sent. 
I had a number of thoughts about addressing the problem:
1. In the current solution the agents poll the plugin with a health check id. If the ID is not consistent with the agent ID then the agent will ask for the state of all of its ports. A very naive option would be to reset the ID and the agents will update their ports accordingly. This may suffice when there are a small amount of agents running a small amount of VM's. This is certainly not scalable.
2. Piggy back information on the health check answers. The answer for the health check should include the updated ID's. Say a port state was update then this ID will be appended to the health check method. The agent knows if it owns the port and if so it will request its details and update accordingly. It is kind of like a notification of all of the updated entities in the last interval.
3. Have the plugin notify the agents of all changes. This requires that a RPC server must be running on all of the agents. This may be similar to the notifications - but is a but more refined as the plugin has the "topic" of the agents.

Any other ideas or suggestions will be great.

In the mean time I have addressed your comments. When I push the next change I'll set it to -1 until we have resolved what we would like to do.

Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-10 16:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

ok, so i see two issues that are still "pending" on this from previous comments.  

1) whether plugin specific requirements like pyudev should go on the main pip-requires

2) whether plugin config files contains the values for rpc configuration, or if they go in quantum.conf

Also, wasn't totally clear if salvatore's comments about configuration-id values and the possibility of missing updates have been addressed.  

Since gary will be out-of-office very soon, let's quickly figure out which of these we need to deal with in this patch, or defer to later bugs.  Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-10 16:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-10 16:25:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Hi,
Following the comments:
1) whether plugin specific requirements like pyudev should go on the main pip-requires
   - I was not sure where to address this. Any suggestions?
2) whether plugin config files contains the values for rpc configuration, or if they go in quantum.conf
   - from my understanding this will be moved to quantum.conf (as part of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9835/). I guess that we can wait till it is in and then I can rebase.
3) configuration id - after Salvatore's comments I dropped this - it proved to just work with the with the start of the agent. If necessary this can be addressed in another patch. I think that at this stage we can leave it out. 
4) I think that we also need to address live migration

I think that #3 and #4 are separate tasks. #2 is pending approval and #1 must be addressed.

I will be back at work on Friday
Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-10 16:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Works for me

commit_message:
RPC support for Linux Bridge Plugin and Agent

blueprint scalable-agent-comms

This is the first stage of the blueprint. This adds support to the linux bridge
plugin.

The development followed the design described in:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MbcBA2Os4b98ybdgAw2qe_68R1NG6KMh8zdZKgOlpvg/edit?pli=1

Change-Id: I4004c05a63ce49f020c2016c8763e73238b465a7

commit_message:
allow injection of SSH keys into Jenkins user

The SSH key in the openstack-ci-puppet repo will be used by default,
unless the JENKINS_SSH_KEY env var is present, in which case that
will be used instead.

Change-Id: If61b10679940f632f49a09fe6f320c82f2a4c25d

    if [[ "$Q_PLUGIN" = "openvswitch" ]]; then

commit_message:
dhcp-agent: Ryu plugin support for dhcp agent

This patch adds Ryu support to dhcp-agent.
fixes bug 1030830
Ryu devstack support is available at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/10117/

Change-Id: I3f5fbe8600b4b674834e317e158bac1856b0349c
Signed-off-by: Isaku Yamahata <yamahata@valinux.co.jp>

subject: Addresses lp#1004971
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-21 10:01:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-merge/251/ : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-pep8/212/ : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-06-21 13:44:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Rather than sleeping for a minute, wouldn't it do just as well to check if the boot time changed? I don't think we are concerned that the boot time might get set backward in time."}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-06-21 16:32:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The issue is that who doesn't track in seconds. If I take the time, reboot, and log back in within the same minute, we can't tell that the server rebooted. I know my team scrambled around trying to find a more accurate method than who, but didn't. I'm completely open to suggestions if anyone has one."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-06-21 17:01:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

All I can think of is that the console log generally has some timestamps, generated ssh keys, or something that is not identical each time the system boots. You could capture the log and check if the captured part of the log changed after reboot.'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-06-21 18:29:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Let me think on this a bit more. I like where you're going. I really did not want to add arbitrary sleeps into tests, so if there's a way we can work around it reliably, I'd like to find it"}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-06-21 18:57:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Google enough and you shall receive. I'm going to code this up, but here's my new proposition. There's also a command called last which gives some nice output like this:

root@boottest:~# last
root     pts/0        50.56.228.65     Thu Jun 21 18:42   still logged in   
reboot   system boot  3.2.0-24-virtual Thu Jun 21 18:35 - 18:42  (00:07) 

And then after a reboot via API I get..

root@boottest:~# last
root     pts/1        50.56.228.65     Thu Jun 21 18:44   still logged in   
reboot   system boot  3.2.0-24-virtual Thu Jun 21 18:44 - 18:44  (00:00)    
root     pts/0        50.56.228.65     Thu Jun 21 18:42 - down   (00:01)    
reboot   system boot  3.2.0-24-virtual Thu Jun 21 18:35 - 18:43  (00:08) 

And after a 3rd this looks like...

root@boottest:~# last
root     pts/1        50.56.228.65     Thu Jun 21 18:46   still logged in   
reboot   system boot  3.2.0-24-virtual Thu Jun 21 18:46 - 18:47  (00:00)    
root     pts/1        50.56.228.65     Thu Jun 21 18:44 - crash  (00:01)    
reboot   system boot  3.2.0-24-virtual Thu Jun 21 18:44 - 18:47  (00:02)    
root     pts/0        50.56.228.65     Thu Jun 21 18:42 - down   (00:01)    
reboot   system boot  3.2.0-24-virtual Thu Jun 21 18:35 - 18:43  (00:08) 

The times could still overlap, but if we count the number of reboots from this, reboot, and verify that that number has incremented, does that sound like a robust enough solution?"}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-06-21 18:57:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry, I meant 2nd reboot above, not 3rd'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-06-21 20:25:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That sounds like it is good enough. Might as well do 'last reboot' which is slightly more robust given that we are actually trying to count reboots."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-06-27 19:45:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

See inline command for getting seconds-granular boot time..."}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-07-05 05:05:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-12 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-12 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-07-12 14:57:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Daryl, please restore this! :)'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-07-19 18:13:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Restored'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-07-20 17:21:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-07-29 17:31:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Restored'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-08-01 04:03:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-01 04:09:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

lgtm. there's a few changes that may be made after rohit's whitebox testing goes in, but this is good for now.

thanks!

-jay"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-01 04:27:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Daryl, the run_ssh attribute was removed from BaseComputeTest because it wasn't used... needs adding back looks like."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-01 04:34:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Fails

I'll take care of it"}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-08-05 21:57:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-05 22:28:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-10 15:11:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

As discussed on IRC, since host isn't actually used, just set host=None in compute/manager.py for this method and we'll be all set.  We can remove 'host' from the compute manager once we go to API version 2.0."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-08-10 15:35:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Looking into this a bit further I think we should just drop 'host' entirely. The following compute driver calls are passed a 'host' parameter but don't actually make use of it:

host_power_action
set_host_enabled
get_host_uptime

If we remove the parameters entirely then we can update the RPC calls to do the same as well."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-08-10 15:35:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Send host in the get_host_uptime RPC call.

The compute manager get_host_uptime call requires the 'host' parameter.
This patch updates the compute RPC API to send it along with the
request.

Partial fix for LP Bug #1035315.

Change-Id: I9820f0a359b0b5aedaec6c8ebfd8ac775f071e00

commit_message:
Create unique volumes_dir for testing.

Updates test_volume.py so that we create a uniq volumes_dir for testing.
This avoids polluting the source tree with fake volume UUID's when running
tests.

Change-Id: I3c37083915effec0eff7c8d9bfffb9f7674fe6f5

'}]
commit_message:
Sync with latest version of openstack.common.setup

Changes since last sync:

 - Fix errors reported by pyflakes.
 - Add SKIP_GENERATE_AUTHORS option to setup.py
 - Add SKIP_WRITE_GIT_CHANGELOG option to setup.py
 - Fix up pre-versioning based on testing in glance.
 - Fix mailmap.
 - Split read_versioninfo into a method.
 - Add support for tag based versioning.
 - Skip argparse when injecting requirements.
 - Add autodoc generation to the build_sphinx command

Change-Id: I11beb2ad0e49adeae96a6b291290c1ec43fba743

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-10 02:25:30.000000000', 'message': "Make FaultWrapper handle exception code = None.

Updates the FaultWrapper middleware so that it properly handles
exceptions which contain a code variable set to None. Previously
you'd get TypeError exception like this in the api.log file:

 TypeError: %d format: a number is required, not NoneType

This was due to the fact that we tried to format a string with
an integer value which was set to None.

I hit this today when using Qpid which does in fact throw exceptions
which contain 'code' variables set to None.

Fixes LP Bug #1035159.

Change-Id: I7193031b1f5f9bf84cdb476f8f1268efc50eadf0
"}]
commit_message:
Make FaultWrapper handle exception code = None.

Updates the FaultWrapper middleware so that it properly handles
exceptions which contain a code variable set to None. Previously
you'd get TypeError exception like this in the api.log file:

 TypeError: %d format: a number is required, not NoneType

This was due to the fact that we tried to format a string with
an integer value which was set to None.

I hit this today when using Qpid which does in fact throw exceptions
which contain 'code' variables set to None.

Fixes LP Bug #1035159.

Change-Id: I7193031b1f5f9bf84cdb476f8f1268efc50eadf0

[{'created': '2012-07-23 12:00:23.000000000', 'message': "Remove unused add_network_to_project() method

This method was added here:

  https://code.launchpad.net/~tr3buchet/nova/multi_nic/+merge/64767

but appears never to have been used.

We can safely remove it and the 'force' parameter to network_associate()
which only it uses.

This removal from the network service RPC API would not warrant a
major version number bump since nothing ever used this part of the
API.

Change-Id: Iba3cf7b61b629ba513a58a38886c9322818accb5
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unused add_network_to_project() method

This method was added here:

  https://code.launchpad.net/~tr3buchet/nova/multi_nic/+merge/64767

but appears never to have been used.

We can safely remove it and the 'force' parameter to network_associate()
which only it uses.

This removal from the network service RPC API would not warrant a
major version number bump since nothing ever used this part of the
API.

Change-Id: Iba3cf7b61b629ba513a58a38886c9322818accb5

[{'created': '2012-07-24 18:20:28.000000000', 'message': "Added support for volume types

As cinder already supports volume types, it's time
to be added in Horizon. The types are added in syspanel.
A volume can either have a *valid* type, or None.

There are two minor issues:
1. When a type is deleted, if there is a volume with
   this type, the type is returned as the id,
   instead of the name. Which is good as consistency,
   but maybe a type should not be deleted if used by a volume?
2. If no vol type is passed(None) value, the type is being
   assigned as 'None', and returned as a string('None')
3. In the create volume type form, the 'Description' is
   empty at the moment, I couldn't find any help info
   to add for volume types...

Some more unit tests will be added, but this is just a preview.

Fixed bug 1022418

Change-Id: Id5fec29a9b81d681bc9a56532ac73fbd27f9a620

commit_message:
Added support for volume types

As cinder already supports volume types, it's time
to be added in Horizon. The types are added in syspanel.
A volume can either have a *valid* type, or None.

There are two minor issues:
1. When a type is deleted, if there is a volume with
   this type, the type is returned as the id,
   instead of the name. Which is good as consistency,
   but maybe a type should not be deleted if used by a volume?
2. If no vol type is passed(None) value, the type is being
   assigned as 'None', and returned as a string('None')
3. In the create volume type form, the 'Description' is
   empty at the moment, I couldn't find any help info
   to add for volume types...

Some more unit tests will be added, but this is just a preview.

Fixes bug 1022418

PATCH SET 2: rebased with master, added some more unit tests

NOTE: forced requirement for python-novaclient==2.6.10,
as Jenkins installs the latest stable 2012.1 instead...

Change-Id: Id5fec29a9b81d681bc9a56532ac73fbd27f9a620

[{'created': '2012-08-08 18:02:35.000000000', 'message': 'Allows Exposing image location based on config

It would be good to allow exposing image location to trusted clients,
say Nova. Thus, helping eventually for internal deployments. This merge
prop enables us to set a config value which will let us either expose
the image location or not.

implements bp api-v2-store-access

Change-Id: I69da3b4ce3fc9261cbf448e797e48affa56281ef

commit_message:
Allows exposing image location based on config

It would be good to allow exposing image location to trusted clients,
say Nova. Thus, eventually helping for internal deployments. This merge
prop enables us to set a config value which will let us either expose
the image location or not expose it.

Edits from markwash:
 * unit test refactoring
 * should not return direct_url as None, that would violate the schema
   which requires direct_url to, when present, be a string

implements bp api-v2-store-access

Change-Id: I69da3b4ce3fc9261cbf448e797e48affa56281ef

commit_message:
Allow empty device name.

Nova supports an empty device name as of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/10908
so we don't need to force one on people (which causes breakages and
confusion).

Change-Id: I92078ec3b434777b8558ac89a22209aa54dee657

commit_message:
disable autorebasing on git review

Fixes bug #1035035

The default autorebasing behavior of git review can have unexpected
consequences, especially when attempting to add a new review that
is dependent on another in progress review. Like accidently turning
other people's code into drafts.

Disabling autorebase will protect us from these kinds of accidents.

Change-Id: I9b555f228c2b9f027b1487060a2232589fc242e7

commit_message:
fix missing deallocation of gateway ip

bug 1032506

when deleting a port that uses the gateway IP, we were not removing
the IPAllocation entry, which resulted in a depedency issue when we
deleted the port that the IPAllocation entry referenced.

Change-Id: I272a6572c389ef8c12585f4b62204f5877cda078

commit_message:
Avoid double-reduction of quota for repeated delete.

Previously when an instance delete is repeated while a
delete is already in progress, the relevant quota usages
were reduced twice.

This is already healing logic in place to catch the special
case where these counts fall below zero, in which case the
sync method re-calculates the appropriate in-use count.

However this will only help the case at hand when the instance
count is itself trending towards zero, and not in general when
there's a healthy number of active instances.

Now we check the instance task state before making the quota
usage reduction.

Change-Id: I91a70ada01dbe050471da43d66774686782584ad

commit_message:
Send 'create volume from snapshot' to the proper host

A simple solution for bug 1008866. When creating volume from snapshot on
multicluster, in volume it will check if snapshot_id is set. If snapshot_id
is set and FLAGS.snapshot_same_host is true, make the call create volume
directly to the volume host where the snapshot resides instead of passing it
through the scheduler. So snapshot can be copy to new volume. The same as
review 9761.

Change-Id: Ic182eb4563b9462704c5969d5116629442df316a

commit_message:
Driver for IBM Storwize and SVC storage.

Volume driver for IBM Storwize and SVC storage systems, along with unit
tests and updated sample config file. The unit tests include a
Storwize/SVC management simulator to allow for testing without
controller hardware. Also added a new exception for volume drivers.

Co-authored-by: Ronen Kat <ronenkat@il.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I3fe9cfcca8d4bddb71c763b526105e34f2652557

commit_message:
Make TerminateInstances compatible with EC2 api

fixes bug 1034377

Currently the XML response for TerminateInstances differs
from the EC2 api specifications and causes the .net EC2 api
from Amazon to crash.

Change-Id: I14172318ed4dc2af16c45be376475885f474c545

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-09 20:43:20.000000000', 'message': 'Traceback when over allocating IP addresses

When a user over allocates a number of IP addresses
via euca-allocate-address, the user will get a nice
traceback saying that they over quota for IP address
allocation. Display a more userfriendly error when this
happens.

LP: #971609

Change-Id: If8586e246564f1069cb60bac9592f9d750522e81
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Traceback when over allocating IP addresses

When a user over allocates a number of IP addresses
via euca-allocate-address, the user will get a nice
traceback saying that they over quota for IP address
allocation. Display a more userfriendly error when this
happens.

LP: #971609

Change-Id: If8586e246564f1069cb60bac9592f9d750522e81
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Straight port of the NetApp driver updates from nova-volume to cinder.

These changes were already accepted into nova-volume, and I have only
altered the exception classes to match the new cinder classes.

blueprint netapp-volume-driver

Change-Id: I0d59db64e00bc7e93223a24dabadbcbd0b290fb9

commit_message:
Use right service name when stopping tgt in unstack.sh

On non-deb systems, 'tgt' is 'tgtd'.

Change-Id: I357b47cf117a5e615eb4af9603b7c5670e5cff1c

commit_message:
Do not cache images that fail checksum verfication

On an image GET, recalculate the image checksum as the image
data is streamed to the client.  Verify that the checksum matches
the original checksum calculated when the image was added to Glance.
If checksum validation fails, purge the image from the cache.

This type of situation could occur if the backend image store
is malfunctioning.

bug 1028496

Change-Id: I9f38bac8360016bb12b5edaad87c50939a538cc0

commit_message:
Make update_db an opt arg in scheduler manager.

Updates the scheduler manager so that update_db is an optional
argument. This fixes issues when trying to make RPC calls
with the most recent version (1.4) of the scheduler RPC API.

Fixes LP Bug #1035004.

Change-Id: Ib998c0465cead1b8e117a7344557f8ff496c7e40

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-08-08 14:29:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-08 21:26:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Nice catch Dan

Something feels wrong here, though - do we know why this was once passed as an object and now as a dict?

My first guess is that because we're sending the full instance over RPC, we're converting the metadata object using jsonutils.to_primitive() and not converting it back on the other side. Not clear to me how a list of InstanceMetadata objects is getting converted into a metadata dict, though, so maybe I'm missing something here.

If it was the no-db-messaging stuff which changed this, there's backwards compat support for the old RPC API versions which we should take into account."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-08 22:04:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Yes, no-db-messaging did this.  to_primitive() converts all of this to a dict using a bit of magic...

InstanceMetadata inherits from NovaBase.  NovaBase implements iteritems().  to_primitive() uses iteritems() to get it converted to a dict:


        elif hasattr(value, 'iteritems'):
            return to_primitive(dict(value.iteritems()),
                                convert_instances=convert_instances,
                                level=level + 1)"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-08 22:07:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Also, nothing is ever converted back to the sqlachemy model in nova-compute.  I'm not sure it's even possible.  Luckily a lot of work had gone in ahead of all of this to change things to use dict-style access on all of the models, anyway."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-08-08 22:16:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Mark: This was related to some of the no-db-messaging changes.  to_primative is almost certainly the blame (work of the devil that it is). And regardless of all this we really should be accessing metadata as a dict anyway right?'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-09 05:43:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The issue is the backwards compat code, e.g. in run_instance:

  if not instance:
      try:
          instance = self.db.instance_get_by_uuid(context, instance_uuid)

It's not a dict there, right?

It's annoying to have to deal with this since we'll probably pull this backwards compat soon enough, but ...

Also, could you add a comment to the commit message about no-db-messaging causing this? I was scratching my head about the "latest format" bit'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-09 13:22:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Good point, Mark.  I think it may work as it is.  The line of code is:

    _inject_file_into_fs(fs, 'meta.js', jsonutils.dumps(metadata))

jsonutils.dumps() will automatically use jsonutils.to_primitive() as needed, so it should get turned into a dict that way.  It needs to be tested to confirm that, though."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-08-09 13:40:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

markmc:

re: Not a dict there right?...

You are correct. However most of the models can be accessed as if they were a dict. See the NovaBase class in models.py.

I think the real issue here was that we should have already been using the dict style syntax when accessing metadata. If we had done that ahead of time none of this would happen.

I suppose my commit message did a poor job of conveying that though.

Also note that we fixed this same issue in xenapi earlier this week: https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/79a2ea2f5f83dc401d089e357bf35dbdfb8be959

For xen this actually cause the instance to ERROR on boot as opposed to libvirt which fails silently when this happens. I'm actually not the biggest fan of silently failing in this regard either."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-09 13:42:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Ah, indeed - good point Russell

I'm good with that. More testing would be good, but it's not a blocker for me since it could be tricky and there's no reason to land "better testing of backwards compat" on Dan as thanks for fixing a bug  that isn't even a backwards compat bug :)'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-09 13:43:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Oh, just a thought - maybe it would be good if the backwards compat code did like loads(dumps(instance)) to make sure there aren't other similar problems?"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-09 15:19:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Yes, that's a good idea.  I would make it:

    instance = jsonutils.to_primitive(db.instance_get_by_uuid(context, instance_uuid))

On a somewhat related note ...the Qpid driver doesn't actually use json serialization.  It does its own serialization into AMQP types in python-qpid.  The kombu and zmq drivers both use json, though.  In all cases, once it's down to primitive types, we should get the exact same dict across rpc."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-09 15:25:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-08-09 17:16:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-08-09 17:16:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-09 17:29:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
Fix the inject_metadata_into_fs in the disk API.

Updates the _inject_metadata_into_fs in the disk/api.py so
that it uses dict-style access. This resolves an issue introduced
in a recent no-db-messaging change.

Includes new test case.

Fixes LP Bug #1034040.

Change-Id: I1bc90a8331419709ab71e5da8c48cd1d54c40f9e

"}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2012-07-25 12:26:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I find it kind of dangerous to not have empty role option in the dropdown. Just an example - I've created a new user using keystone's CLI, without any roles. Then opened the edit form  for that user in Syspanel/Users, and the roles dropdown has 'KeystoneAdmin' selected as first choice. If I don't pay attention to it, and want just to change let's say the email - I'll make this user KeystoneAdmin(or what's the first option there) !!! In some case one might need to have user without any roles..."}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2012-07-26 05:44:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

Users will always have a role assigned, when creating the User from UI it displays a role dropdown without any options and the default role pre-selected.

If I add a blank option for role in the Update User, it would be inconsistent with create user and other pages that displays role.'}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2012-07-26 05:57:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2012-07-26 05:57:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/5068/testReport : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2012-07-27 08:24:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Do not merge

(2 inline comments)

I think there is something conceptually wrong here. First of all - roles<->Project is 1-to-Many relation. So when using a dropdown to add a role for a project, we do not change the role, but actually add a new role. That's the reason why this code now raises an exception if trying to add the same role twice - it is already present for the user-tenant..

I would suggest something simple - to remove the role dropdown and immediately after updating the user's default tenant:
 
    api.user_update_tenant(request, user, tenant)

to be added a check for existing roles and to show a warning if no role exists for the tenant - something like this:

    user_roles = api.roles_for_user(request, user, tenant)
    if not user_roles:
        messages.warning(request, _('The user %s has no role defined for that project.' % data['name']))

Otherwise the current UI with the dropdown is misleading and doesn't reflect the actual relation between user, tenant and roles. Also there was a discussion some time ago that the current form for adding user to project have to be modified as to allow selecting multiple roles instead of a single role as it is now. So with this change we have 2 places to add a role for an user to a project, but none of these does what is expected to be done.

Last, but not least - the role is per project. So changing the project dropdown should change the selected value of the role dropdown accordingly. Otherwise I can imagine lots of cases of how the site operator submits undesired changes using this form ... The operator simply doesn't know what is/are the current role(s) for a given project, if they decide to change it. This kind of information is available in Project >> Modify users, and for me this is the right place to modify the roles."}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2012-07-30 01:41:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2012-07-30 01:43:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Changes made based on review comments from Tihomir.

Instead of adding a role dropdown, I just added a warning message if the user does not have any role for the assigned Default Tenant.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-30 01:56:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-horizon-merge/1123/consoleFull : SUCCESS

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-horizon-python27/522/testReport : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-horizon-selenium/31/testReport : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/5250/testReport : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2012-07-30 13:57:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: No score

Looks good to me, but as a new 'warning' is being returned in the form on a certain condition, I think it would be nice to have a unit test for it."}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2012-07-30 17:41:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Got it, I'll add the check for warning message in the next patch."}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2012-07-31 05:15:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-31 05:37:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

commit_message:
Warn user if no role assigned in default Project

Fixes Bug #1011461

When the default project settings is updated, the
form will show a warning if there are no roles assigned
for the default project. This will prompt the user to
assignd the role using Project >> Modify users.

Change-Id: I3abf3d154e3c0decd918e15f04eaef84b4aaa748

commit_message:
project workflow: project membership UI

* Update Project workflow now includes a tab to update project members
* Can add/remove existing users from project and update roles
* Can add a new user via inline object creation
* Can filter both lists!
* Changed css/jquery to make things appear more like other tables
* Fixed a few JS bugs
* "Fixed" exception handling for now, although it naively redirects the
   user out of the workflow

partially implements blueprint tenant-creation-workflow

Change-Id: I38589bf3ee4c33c49df982417d995c141f4e6709

Fixes bug #1035035

The default autorebasing behavior of git review can have unexpected
consequences, especially when attempting to add a new review that

commit_message:
disable autorebasing on git review

Fixes bug #1035035

The default autorebasing behavior of git review can have unexpected
consequences, especially when attempting to add a new review that
is dependent on another in progress review. Like accidently turning
other people's code into drafts.

Disabling autorebase will protect us from these kinds of accidents

Change-Id: I7000a201cf3d440e4ac01c9fd32ba984f583ffcf

[{'created': '2012-08-08 17:02:23.000000000', 'message': "Remove redundant 'availability_zone' config options.

There are two availability_zone related config options now:
  node_availability_zone and storage_availability_zone
While volume API use node_availability_zone, the scheduler use
the other, which breaks when these two options have different
values.

This patch removes 'node_availability_zone' so that end user
can specify 'availability zone' when create volumes using

Change-Id: Ia2f0710908495ec64dacd2ee9bd10d7f8cd415df
"}, {'created': '2012-08-09 01:59:40.000000000', 'message': "Remove redundant 'availability_zone' config options.

  node_availability_zone and storage_availability_zone
While volume API uses node_availability_zone, the scheduler uses
the other, which causes failure in scheduler when these two options
have different values.

commit_message:
Remove redundant 'availability_zone' config options.

There are two availability_zone related config options now:
  node_availability_zone and storage_availability_zone
While volume API uses node_availability_zone, the scheduler uses
the other, which causes failure in scheduler when these two options
have different values.

This patch removes 'node_availability_zone' so that end user
can specify 'availability zone' when create volumes using
Simple scheduler.

Partially implement blueprint implement-availability-zones

Change-Id: Ia2f0710908495ec64dacd2ee9bd10d7f8cd415df

commit_message:
Admin users should be restricted from seeing all
snapshots by default.

  * Now to view all snapshots across all tenants you need
    to include the all_tenants=1 GET param in your api request.
  * Fixes remaining issues blocking bug #967882

Change-Id: I2a8338d77badc70201bb315198183f2091df43fb

[{'created': '2012-08-09 15:10:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix stale instances being sent over rpc.

There were a number of places in compute/api.py that were calling
self.update() for an instance, but not sending an instance that contains
those updates over rpc.  This patch fixes them.

The changes to the unit tests were required because its stubs were
returning an instance without a host set in some cases.  So, the result
of self.update() had no host and the rpcapi would blow up since it had
no idea where to send the message.

This patch does not fix self.update() before prep_resize, because it is
being addressed in this patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/11050/

Change-Id: I4efc922a6a0af0605d4d63012d55ff8473211fd5
'}, {'created': '2012-08-09 15:32:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix stale instances being sent over rpc.

self.update() for an instance, but not sending an instance that contains
those updates over rpc.  This patch fixes them.

The changes to the unit tests were required because its stubs were

of self.update() had no host and the rpcapi would blow up since it had
no idea where to send the message.

This patch does not fix self.update() before prep_resize, because it is

Change-Id: I4efc922a6a0af0605d4d63012d55ff8473211fd5
'}]
commit_message:
Fix stale instances being sent over rpc.

There were a number of places in compute/api.py that were calling
self.update() for an instance, but not sending an instance that contains
those updates over rpc.  This patch fixes them.

The changes to the unit tests were required because its stubs were
returning an instance without a host set in some cases.  So, the result
of self.update() had no host and the rpcapi would blow up since it had
no idea where to send the message.

This patch does not fix self.update() before prep_resize, because it is
being addressed in this patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/11050/

Change-Id: I4efc922a6a0af0605d4d63012d55ff8473211fd5

Send updated instance model to schedule_prep_resize

A stale instance model was being passed to schedule_prep_resize.

Fixes bug 1034595

[{'created': '2012-08-07 00:28:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix traceback when detaching volumes via EC2

When detaching a volume from an instance it results
in the following traceback:

Cinderclient connection created using URL: http://192.168.1.103:8776/v1/bc02ec05c5fa4a5bb3020b617f3574e2
2012-08-06 18:58:32 ERROR nova.api.ec2 [req-1fd2f017-8a11-481f-b901-ae61d3f55c94 demo demo] Unexpected error raised: 'instance_uuid'
2012-08-06 18:58:32 TRACE nova.api.ec2 Traceback (most recent call last):
2012-08-06 18:58:32 TRACE nova.api.ec2   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/api/ec2/__init__.py", line 474, in __call__
2012-08-06 18:58:32 TRACE nova.api.ec2     result = api_request.invoke(context)
2012-08-06 18:58:32 TRACE nova.api.ec2   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/api/ec2/apirequest.py", line 81, in invoke
2012-08-06 18:58:32 TRACE nova.api.ec2     result = method(context, **args)
2012-08-06 18:58:32 TRACE nova.api.ec2   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/api/ec2/cloud.py", line 799, in detach_volume
2012-08-06 18:58:32 TRACE nova.api.ec2     self.compute_api.detach_volume(context,volume_id=volume_id)
2012-08-06 18:58:32 TRACE nova.api.ec2   File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/api.py", line 1642, in detach_volume
2012-08-06 18:58:32 TRACE nova.api.ec2     instance_uuid = volume['instance_uuid']
2012-08-06 18:58:32 TRACE nova.api.ec2 KeyError: 'instance_uuid'

By the time the volume in the cinder database the instance_uuid is already 'NULL',
so get the instance_uuid from the volume before its detached.

Fixes LP: #1033713

Change-Id: Id5515881b08af9d0832b4b620c03e471fdff0823
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
